loans.name: Yosra

texts.en:
Yosra is a 65-year-old woman.  She is married and has two sons and three daughters.  Her husband has a decent pension from the Palestinian National Authority.   Yosra has a grocery store and wants to improve its conditions by purchasing more groceries for sale, but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take a loan in the amount of $2,000 from FATEN. 

When Yosra gets the loan, she will be able to purchase more groceries and have more products to sell.  This will improve her grocery store positively and increase her income, which will enable her to provide better living conditions for her family. 

Yosra is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in her grocery store.

loans.use: buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ran

texts.en: Ran, 54 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a soldier earning $3 per day. They have three children; one is studying and two more are working as construction workers, each earning $3.50 per day. Every month, Ran has to spend $68 on food, $10 on electricity, and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a plot of land for doing farming. She wants to help her sons to buy other construction materials to support their career so that they can make better income.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for doing farming.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 32-year-old married man and owner of a car washing garage for 13 years. This long experience gave him customers' trust and good income. He works hard to stay up-to-date with all new cleaning tools and ways to keep his customers satisfied with what his service.

Alaa is a hard-working man, liked by most of his customers. His good reputation differentiates him from competitors, and this is his speciA. advantage.

To improve his living and to increase his income, Alaa thought of establishing a new business that is attractive to most teenaged villagers: he will open an internet café, which will help them in spending useful time in their spare time and it will help in keeping them away from bad habits such as drugs and many others through a loan he applied for from Kiva partner A. Majmoua.

Alaa hopes to improve both businesses more and more in the future and to continue having customers trust him.

loans.use: To open an Internet cafe.

loans.name: Sotheara

texts.en: Sotheara, 25 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a worker who earns $3 per day. They have one child who is 5 years old. Every month, Sotheara has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a plot of land for farming. She wants to get a new career but now she doesn't know what she wants to do because she doesn’t have enough money.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for farming.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en: Sherlita is 52 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married and has two children. Sherlita has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stock for her general store. Sherlita has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Colombe Plus Group

texts.en: Charlotte is the chairwoman of the community bank named “Colombe Plus.” It is composed of 22 members who are united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses. Charlotte is 53 years old and is the mother of two children whose ages are 31 and 33. She has been selling smoked fish since 1999. She is determined with Hope’s loans to develop her business and achieve her ambition of one day opening a general store. Charlotte intends with the next loan to increase the stock of her goods by buying three bags of smoked fish and reselling them at a profit. Her business generates a profit of $100 per week.

loans.use: to increase the stock of her goods by buying three bags of smoked fish and reselling them at profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sut

texts.en: Sut, 52 years old, is a fish seller who earns $5 per day. Her husband is a fisher who earns $4 per day. They have four children, one of whom is studying and the other three are working, earning $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on school fees and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy fishing equipment and a boat for fishing. This family doesn’t want to change their career of selling fish because this career can bring good income and they are knowledgeable about it.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment and a boat for fishing.

loans.name: Mountaha

texts.en: Mountaha is a 47-year-old married woman. She works in selling gifts and gadgets in her small shop located in Tripoli. Mountaha opened this business to help her husband in raising their two children and to provide them with the necessary education to make their own future. Mountaha is a hardworking woman with an excellent reputation. She works hard to keep her shop updated with all levels of toys and gifts that suit all customers’ needs. To stay like this, Mountaha is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase her business capital with new gift collections, especially for the coming Christmas season. She will also increase the school supplements capital through the requested materials. Mountaha is planning to open a bigger shop in the future with special decorations attractive to everyone passing by.

loans.use: to buy new gift collections for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Shodmonoi

texts.ru: Шодмоной разведенная имеет одну дочь. Для содержания семьи она занимается 15 лет бизнесом. Торгует разными товарами, товарами первой необходимости для детей и для взрослых. Ей помогает её дочь. Полученная прибыль идет на расширение бизнеса и содержания семьи. Она хочет получить займ на приобретение зимних товаров и пополнение оборота. Она надеется получить займ.
texts.en: Shodmonoi is divorced and has one daughter.  In order to support her family, Shodmonoi has been involved in business for 15 years.  She sells various merchandise and goods necessary for children and adults.  Her daughter helps her in this business.  The received profit goes into business expansion and support for the family.  Shodmonoi wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of winter goods and refilling revolving capital.  She hopes to get this loan.

loans.use: to purchase winter merchandise

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Early marriage is not a hindrance to attaining the dreams you had before marriage. Rosemarie did not finish her college education because at the age of 21 she got married. Now, she is 35 with five children. Her children are all in school between high school and elementary level.

Rosemarie operates a tricycle passenger transport business. Aside from transportation, she also manages a hog raising business. She has been running her businesses for three years. Most of her earnings from the businesses go toward the daily allowances of her children in school.

Rosemarie is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy accessories, tires and fuel for the maintenance of her tricycle. She hopes to continue sending her children to school until college.  She wants her children to experience what she did not experience before, that’s why she will do her best to give the best quality of life to her family.

loans.use: buy accessories, tires and fuel for her tricycle

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is a 59-year-old married woman with five children. She has been engaged in seaweed farming for five years. Esterlita earns 5,000 PHP per month with her business. She requested a loan to buy straw, wooden pegs and other materials for seaweed farming. She hopes to be successful in her business. Esterlita also plans to buy home appliances with her profit.

loans.use: to buy straw, wooden pegs and other materials for seaweed farming

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 38 years old and married to Paul who is employed. They are blessed with one child who is five years old. She has been in a farming activity for the past one year with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Ruth will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will venture into dairy keeping. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her child up to university level and improve the living standard of the family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 40-year-old housewife who works with her husband mixing cleaning material and filling it into bottles to sell.

Iman’s husband owns a small distributing bus that helps them to distribute their products to the supermarkets in their area. At the same time, Iman also sells her cleaning products at home mostly for housewives.

Now Iman has applied for this loan to buy more cleaning material in a larger quantity to get it at a wholesale price.

loans.use: to buy more cleaning material at a wholesale price.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Erma has a construction shop that sells hollow blocks. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw materials for making hollow blocks and sand.

Erma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Erma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making hollow blocks and sand.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, maize, cooking oil, soap, and mealie-meal.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat is a 54-year-old married woman, who has worked as a tailor for 23 years. Her house is her working place. She insisted on having this business to help her husband provide for their living and to stay at home, to reply for her precious husband’s needs because her business isn’t taking too much space.

Hayat is a woman with a good reputation. She is very talented in her business, and most of her customers recommend her to others. Her prices are encouraging and affordable to anyone, which is an advantage in which she invests.

Hayat is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to help her husband pay what’s left from the price of their dream house, the house that they’ve been working hard their entire life to get, and their dream is almost coming true. With the requested loan, Hayat and her husband will secure their elderly life in their own house, and they will rest without thinking of how they have to pay the rent at the end of each month if one of them wasn’t capable of working anymore. She said that they are aging with no one to look after them, which is why they are working hard not to be in need of anyone in the future.

loans.use: To pay what's left on the payment for her house.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is a 28-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Cicilia requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase more charcoal for sale. She will use the profit from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.en:
Obdulia is 56 years old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children.

Obdulia has a fish vending business and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Obdulia has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Amany

texts.en: Amany is a 22-year-old young woman who is married and has two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Amany wants to purchase new home furniture that she doesn't have in her house, which is necessary to improve her living conditions. These items include bedroom furniture and living room furniture. However, she hasn't enough money to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $2,500 from FATEN. When Amany gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase home furniture she needs to improve her life. This will enable her to provide better home conditions for her family. Amany is a conservative woman, so her husband Ahmad is photographed instead at the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru: Елена тогрует постельным бельем на рынке, сейчас на него повышенный спрос у нее большая торговая точка и ей надо много товара. Елена планирует закупить турецкий товар в Одессе. За товаром она ездит вместе с мужем, у которого тоже свой бизнес, на семейном микроавтобусе. Проживают в доме в пригороде с  меньшим сыном и старшей замужней дочерью. Внук Миша проходит реабилитацию по онкологии ,недавно у дочери родилась еще  девочка (7мес) здоровая. Вся большая семья живет вместе. Лена очень довольна возможностью брать кредиты и использует прибыль  как на развитие бизнеса, так и на помощь детям.
texts.en: Yelena sells bedding at the market.  There is currently an increased demand for bedding, and, having a big retail outlet, she needs a lot of merchandise.  Yelena plans to buy Turkish merchandise in Odessa.  She travels for the merchandise with her husband, who also has his own business, in a family minivan.  They lives in a house in a suburb with the youngest son and oldest married daughter.  Their grandson Misha is going through a oncological rehabilitation, and their daughter recently has a healthy daughter (7 months).  The entire big family lives together.  Yelena is very happy to have a possibility to obtain loans and uses the profit to develop her business, as well as to help her children.

loans.use: to purchase bedding

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina and her husband are both farmers.  They did not pursue their education due to lack of financial support. They plan to educate their six children so that they will not be like them.  They want their children to earn a degree so that they will find good jobs someday. Despite financial difficulty, they look for possible solutions to support the education of their children. 

Carolina and her husband aim to increase their corn production so that they will earn a higher income and satisfy their needs.  Due to the high cost of commodities, Carolina is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay the labor cost required in planting corn. They hope that this loan will help them make an improvement in their business.

loans.use: buy corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay labor cost

loans.name: Putheavy

texts.en: Putheavy, 45 years old, is a housewife. She is a single mother with three children, all of whom are working. Each of the children earns $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $55 on food and $5 on electricity. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy dirt to fill her house, which is flooding. The loan helps her not to live with flooding. All of the payments are made by her children who support her.

loans.use: To buy dirt to fill her house which is flooding

loans.name: Damba

texts.en: Damba is 22 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Currently, his wife is looking after her daughter. He started his private taxi service business in 2009 by purchasing his own sedan. Now that their daughter is old enough to join kindergarten, his wife is a cook at a private bakery company. Damba also operates a grocery retail business. He is a strong and diligent man who says, "Now that we're parents, we need more income to support our daughter." He is requesting 250,000 MNT to purchase more vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old married man and father of two children. He has been the owner of a grocery store for six years. His store is well known in the region because he works hard to keep it filled with all his customers’ requests. 

He is a hard worker. He has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three years with a good standing history and his previous loans helped a lot in expanding and improving his business. 
 
Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to expand his shop with a special brick tent with glass windows to widen the space and to increase the quantity of products he is purchasing. This will help to increase his income. 

Ali hopes to stay ready to reply to most of his customers’ requests. He also hopes he can expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To expand the width of shop and increase the quantity of products he sells

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Genara has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Genara has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Genara hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 45-year-old married man and the father of four children. He has been the owner of a vegetable shop for 15 years. This is Kassem’s only source of income and he works hard to support his family. Kassem is applying for a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva for the first time, in order to improve his shop by investing in special tables to display his vegetables. He will also purchase highly-requested vegetables that he has not been able to afford.
Kassem hopes to expand his business in the future through starting in wholesale trade and developing a good inheritance for his children.

loans.use: to increase the stock for his vegetable store.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 24 years old, single and lives with his parents in the village where he plants and harvests corn and sells to traders. He wants to lift his family from poverty.  That's why he devotes himself to his corn farming business.  He has managed his corn farming business for over ten years and earned about PHP 37,000 with his last crop. 

Ronald wants to borrow PHP 50,000 to purchase seedlings, pesticides and fertilizer for his farm. He hopes to maintain his business to secure his family's  future.

loans.use: buy seedlings, pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 42 years old, married and has six children. She has a retail store selling fruits and vegetables, e.g., bananas, eggplant and onions, and eggs too. She established this business three years ago. 

Edna wants to enhance her business to earn additional income, so she is asking for a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy bananas, eggplant and cabbages to sell. This will help increase her earnings. She would like to improve her sales to save for the education of her children. She wants them to achieve their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy bananas, eggplant and cabbages to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Lecibel

texts.en:
Lecibel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Lecibel has a shop where she sells snacks like rice and pancakes. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy the ingredients needed to make snacks.
Lecibel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lecibel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed to make snack foods.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old single man, working in agriculture for the past six years. Ali is a hard worker; he loves his business and works hard to improve it. Ali farms other people's fields. He fertilizes them and works hard to make them productive. He sells the crops in wholesale markets after he pays what’s requested from the owners of the land. Most people who own land find it hard to harvest and plant their own fields, which makes Ali's services in high demand.
He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy the necessary fertilizers and agricultural chemicals for his business. He prefers to buy these supplies in large quantities, because that brings down the price. 
Ali hopes to own his own land in the future, because then he would be able to keep more of the profits and not pay the landowner.

loans.use: To buy the necessary fertilizers and agricultural chemicals.

loans.name: Gulom

texts.ru: Гулом отец пятерых детей. Жена его домохозяйка. Источником содержания его большой семьи является доходы, полученные от выращивания пшеницы и картофеля. Работа на посевной земле требует ухода. Покупка минеральных удобрений, семян – все это требует финансовых вложений. Полученный доход от собранного урожая он хочет потратить на свадьбу сына, которую он планирует провести на следующий год. А для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений он хочет получить займ в размере 3000 Сомони.
texts.en: Gulom is a father of five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  The source of income for his large family is the profit received from the business of growing wheat and potatoes.  Work on sowable land requires care.  Purchase of mineral fertilizers, seeds - all of that requires financial investments.  Gulom wants to use the profit from his harvest to spend on a wedding for his son, which he plans to hold next year.  And he wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 3000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Nozim

texts.ru: Нозим женат. Имеет двоих детей. Продажей фруктов занимается 10 лет. По бизнесу ему помогает его мать. Данный бизнес приносит хорошие доходы, но для этого следует закупать фрукты оптом по низким ценам и продавать розницу по завышенным. Нозим хочет получить займ для оптового закупа фруктов в преддверье Нового года и получить хорошие доходы от продажи под праздник. Он надеется получить кредит и в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Nozim is married and has two children.  He has been involved in selling fruits for ten years.  His mother helps him in this business.  This business brings in a good income, but requires that fruits are purchased at low wholesale prices and then sold at higher retail prices.  Nozim wants to obtain this loan for the wholesale purchase of fruits in anticipation of the New Year's Day and earn a good income from the sales for the holiday.  He hopes to receive your support in obtaining this loan.

loans.use: to purchase fruits

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 33-year-old married man and father of one child. He has worked in transportation for 11 years. Khaled owns a van which he uses to transport people from one place to another. During the summer, he takes tourists all over the Lebanese borders. Khaled has a very good reputation; he works hard to provide his family with a good life and to improve his business.
Khaled is requesting a second loan from A. Majmoua to do the necessary maintenance on his van. Through his previous loan he learned how to be committed to others.
Khaled hopes to improve his business in the future, through trading his van for a bigger bus capable of taking more people.

loans.use: To do the necessary maintenance on his van

loans.name: Nonilona

texts.en:
Nonilona is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Nonilona has a shop where she sells snacks like rice cakes and hot cakes. She has had this business for ten years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy the ingredients to make more snacks for sale.
Nonilona has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nonilona hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Inom

texts.ru: Ином женат, отец четверых детей. Он опытный предприниматель. Более 15 лет он занимается выращиванием пшеницы и откормом скота на селе. От проданной пшеницы он получает доходы, также откорм и купля-продажа крупного рогатого скота приносит немалые доходы. Но следует отметить о том что, по словам Инома скот нужно купить своевременно, когда цена на них падает. Сейчас как раз таки такое время. Вот поэтому для приобретения скота, минеральных удобрений и семян ему нужны средства. Этот займ поможет ему расширить его бизнес.
texts.en: Inom is married and is a father of four children.  He is an experienced entrepreneur.  He has been involved in growing wheat and fattening up livestock for over 15 years.  Inom earns an income from sales of wheat, and fattening up and buying-selling cattle brings in a good income as well.  We need to note that, according to Inom's words, livestock purchases need to be timed when their prices drop.  Right now is precisely this time.  Inom needs funds to purchase livestock, mineral fertilizers and seeds.  This loan will help him to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas was able to grow her business with her previous loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings from Faulu Kenya.  Currently, she has employed two people to assist her in the business. She says that Faulu Kenya has been a blessing to her business. 

Dorcas wants to start a business making and selling pop-corn to generate more income for her family.  Hence, she has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a popcorn machine.

loans.use: To buy a popcorn machine

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
At 57, Antonio patiently manages their corn farming business to earn a living. He is now a widower and has three adult children. Most of their children are already married and manage their own family. He aims to improve his business to earn and save for their future and to support his grandchildren. Sometimes he encounters hardships and problems in life but through his patience and determination, he is able to overcome them.

He aims to expand his corn plantation to increase his production, but due to financial difficulty, he is asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for the maintenance of his corn production. He hopes that he will have a plentiful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Sergey

texts.ru: Сергею нужно закупить партию товара, так как он расширил свой бизнес и сейчас у него две торговых точки. Он поставил свего сына менеджером в отдел сумок в торговом центре в Новомосковске, а сам возобновил торговлю на рынке. Получив кредит Сергей планирует поехать на оптовый рынок в Одессу на своем Фолькваген КАДИ белого цвета, который он использует как для бизнеса, так и для семьи. Вместе со своей женой Еленой Сергей проживают в частном доме в пригороде. Вместе с ними живут их дети и внуки.
texts.en: Sergey needs to buy another inventory of merchandise because he expanded his business and now has two retail outlets.  He put his son in charge of the purses department in a Novomoskovsk wholesale center and resumed sales at a market.  Having received this loan, Sergey plans to go to a wholesale market in Odessa in his white Volkswagen Kadi, which he uses for his business and family.  Together with his wife Yelena, Sergey lives in a private house in a suburb.  Their children and grandchildren live with them as well.

loans.use: to purchase purses, backpacks and suitcases

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tree seedlings.

loans.name: Ma. Celiet

texts.en: Ma. Celiet is 28 years old and a married woman with two children aged nine and eight. Her husband is a fisherman. Ma. Celiet sells her husband's catch at the market. This business earns about 5000 PHP per month. Ma. Celiet will use her loan to buy an icebox and fishing nets. She plans to buy home appliances with her profit.

loans.use: to buy an icebox and fishing nets.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed with six children. 
Joseph provides motorcycle, or habal-habal, services. He has had this business for 20 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy gasoline and tools for maintaining his motorcycle.
Joseph has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joseph hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and tools for maintenance.

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is a 24-year-old young woman. She is married with one son. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Alaa' wants to improve her house conditions to live with her family in better living conditions by purchasing new home furniture such as living room seats, dining room furniture, etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for the furniture, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Alaa' gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase new home furniture and provide her family better home living conditions. 

Alaa' is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase home furniture to improve her family life conditions.

loans.name: Cliff

texts.en:
In the photo is Cliff who does construction work to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years and employs 10-20 people on contract basis.  Being a married man with four children, he works hard in his business to provide for his family.
Cliff hopes to expand his business so that he can generate more income for his family.  He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sand and cement.

loans.use: To buy sand and cement

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a hardworking business woman aged 29. She is married and blessed with one child. She operates a printing business to earn a living. Catherine has been in the business for the last three years. She has employed one person to help her to manage the business. In the next 5 years, she wants to open another outlet of her business. She is requesting for a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy printing paper.

loans.use: To buy printing paper

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en: Emmah is aged 25 and single. She describes herself as a hardworking business woman. For the last two years, she has been practicing dairy farming to make a living. She also does poultry farming for more income.  She has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more chickens for raising.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en: Virgincita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has had a sari-sari store for more than five years. Virgincita sells items like vinegar, canned goods and detergent to the people in her community. Virgincita works hard to support her family. She has requested a loan to buy more items like canned goods and soap. Victoria hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods and soap.

loans.name: Hajidmaa

texts.en: Hajidmaa is 51 years old and lives with her son in an apartment in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter is a clerk in her retail business and her younger one goes to college. Hajidmaa started her business in 2000 by renting a space to run a barber shop. Also, she runs a garment retail trading business. Over the years she has acquired many regular customers. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to buy winter garments and some new equipment for her barber shop from China. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I will do everything I can for my daughter to get educated." She is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy equipment for her barber shop.

loans.use: To buy equipment.

loans.name: Esterlinda

texts.en:
Esterlinda is 57 years old and lives in Pines, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children. 
Esterlinda has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month. She has requested a loan of 3,000 for additional capital for her snack vending business. 
Esterlinda has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Esterlinda hopes to have a food stall in the market.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock.

loans.name: David Nguyai

texts.en:
David practices mixed farming. He used his previous loan to buy a dairy goat, which has given him a good income. He paid off his previous loan on time without default. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. David will use the loan to buy animal feed and seedlings for his farm.

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing which will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and seedlings.

loans.name: Naimajon

texts.ru: Наимаджон замужем имеет четверых детей. Бизнесом она занимается на протяжении многих лет. Муж занимается торговлей. Она мастер на все руки умелая рукодельница. У нее свой цех по вышиванию и пошиву национальной одежды. Займ она хочет получить для оптового закупа фурнитуры, тканей и золотошвейных ниток. Она надеется на одобрение займа для улучшения условий труда и увеличения объема производства рукодельев.
texts.en: Naimajon is married and has four children.  She has been involved in business for many years.  Her husband is involved in sales.  Naimajon is masterful working with her hands and a skilled craftswoman.  She has her own factory of embroidering and sewing national clothing.  Naimajon wants to obtain this loan for the wholesale purchase of accessories, fabrics and gold embroidery threads.  She hopes that her loan will be approved in order to improve her working conditions and increase the volume of production.

loans.use: to purchase accessories, fabrics and gold embroidery threads

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Erlinda has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to stock more canned goods, snacks and beverages .
Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
У Ирины возникла необходимость обновить сезонный товар и закупить женскую обувь, плащи, свитера, брюки.
За счет предыдущего кредита у Ирины увеличился доход, так же увеличился ассортимент товара. Она приобрела дополнительную торговую точку, смогла ее оборудовать для торговли.
Благодаря прибыли у Ирины в доме был произведен ремонт, поклейка обоев, покраска, замена канализационной системы и системы отопления. Ирина выделяется среди других предпринимателей своей общительностью и искреней верой в Бога.
texts.en:
Irina now needs to renew the seasonal merchandise and purchase women's shoes, coats, sweaters and pants.

Her previous loan increased Irina's income and also increased the variety of merchandise. She purchased additional vendor space and was able to prepare it for business.

Thanks to the income she received Irina's house was remodeled with new wallpaper, paint job and replacement of sewage and heating systems. Irina stands out from other business owners with her sociability and sincere belief in God.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes, coats, sweaters and pants.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 31-year-old married man, father of four children and owner of an international calls shop and a café since 2010. His customers say that he serves the best hooka*.  He also owns an espresso machine and serves his customers coffee.
Ahmad is a hardworking man. He used to fix and refurbish used furniture, but he decided to start this cafe to more easily meet his big family’s requests.
Ahmad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to expand his shop and buy a new espresso machine to better meet his customers' needs.
Ahmad is working with Al Majmoua for the first time; he hopes it will help him for future investments.
He hopes to buy a house and own another shop in the future.

* A hookah (Hindustani: हुक़्क़ा (Devanagari), (Nastaleeq) huqqah). A hooka, also known as sheesha or waterpipe shisha, is a single or multi-stemmed (often glass-based) instrument for smoking in which the smoke is cooled and filtered by passing through water. ...source Wikipedia 18-10-2011

loans.use: To buy a new espresso machine.

loans.name: Bathuyag

texts.en: Bathuyag is 35 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. His two older kids are in school and the younger one goes to kindergarten. He started his photography business in 2001 with 100,000 MNT. He has built his assets to 1,000,000 MNT. His business has been profitable since 2001. Because of his old camera, his photography quality is poor. He is a creative and hardworking man who says, "I have a mission to become the province's largest photography studio owner." He is requesting 1,500,000 to buy a new camera and accessories.

loans.use: To buy a new camera and accessories.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 
Emelyn has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to stock more canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Emelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 38 years old and a married woman with seven children. Four of them are in school. She has a business selling g-nut paste in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.
Christine has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sacks of g-nuts to make into paste to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more g-nuts for sale.

loans.name: Leoniso

texts.en: Leoniso is a 49-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He is a food vendor. Leoniso and his wife work together to improve their business. They sell banana cue (deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar), rice cakes and other local delicacies to the people in their community. Leoniso has requested a loan to buy raw ingredients such as bananas, oil, sugar, rice and flour. Leoniso hopes to have a successful business in the future. He also hopes for his family to always be happy.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as bananas, oil, sugar, rice and flour.

loans.name: Shingimizi Group

texts.fr:
Joselyne est une commerçante âgée de 29ans qui habite  la localité de Bwoga en Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle vend les bananes depuis 10ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont 1 étudie.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 80,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bananes  à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« SHINGIMIZI».
texts.en:
Joselyne is a 29-year-old merchant living in Bwoga, a village in the province of Gitega in central Burundi. She has been selling bananas for ten years. She is also a farmer. She attended elementary school until sixth grade. She is married and the mother of three children, with one of them studying.

Joselyne will use her loan share of 80,000 Burundi francs provided through Kiva to increase her working capital and buy large quantities of bananas for resale. She expects to make a good profit.

Joselyne is a member of Shingimizi Community Group.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy large quantities of bananas for resale.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 41-year-old married man and father of three children. Mahdi has worked in agriculture for 11 years. He used to be a taxi driver but he loves agricultural work more than any other business.
Mahdi works hard to provide his children with the best education. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, for the first time, to pay for his children's primary school fees. He hopes to see his children become important educated people in their society and hopes to provide them with everything they might need.
Mahdi hopes to buy more tractors in the future to expand his business.

loans.use: To pay for his children's primary school fees.

loans.name: Dayanbaatar

texts.en: Dayanbaatar is 31 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in his parent's yard in Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife stays at home with her infant. He started his taxi service business in 2009 with his own car. Also, he runs a car service workshop. He is a certified repairman who is very talented in his business. The car service is more profitable. Therefore, he decided to run the car service full time. He is having trouble running the business due to the garage's heating problem.  Now that winter is approaching, he needs to build a new heating system. He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to build a heating system.

loans.use: To build a heating system

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо замужем имеет детей невесток и внуков. Муж работает таксистом. Она предприниматель разного профиля. Занимается откормом скота, выращиванием помидоров, продажей неочищенного риса. Семья у них большая и содержать семью в достатке удается не всем. Мархабо хочет получить займ  для строительства дома и улучшения благосостояния семьи. Она надеется на одобрение займа.
texts.en: Marhabo is married and has children, daughters-in-law and grandchildren.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  Marhabo is a multidisciplinary entrepreneur.  She is involved in fattening up livestock, growing tomatoes and selling unprocessed rice.  She has a large family, and it is not always possible to provide abundance for them.  Marhabo wants to obtain a loan to build a house and improve her family's well-being.  She hopes that her loan will be approved.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed, with 3 children.  Julito has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. 

He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Julito has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Julito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Selling fish at the public market occupies Florentina's daily schedule. She had been doing this for almost 10 years. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month. She had to generate an income because she had three children going to school. She had eight children but due to financial problems, she was not able to send them all to school. 

Now, she wants to improve her sales. That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy crabs, shrimp and milkfish to sell to increase her sales. 

She wants to continuously educate her two children to acquire a degree and someday improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy crabs, shrimp and milkfish to sell

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson paid his previous loan well and in good time. He still grows crops in his area of abode.  He managed to harvest a lot of food, which he sold and from which he was able to get better returns.

He is applying for his third loan term with KADET . Samson will use the loan to buy farm manure and seedlings for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to export his farm produce which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбар замужем. Имеет троих детей. Она и ее муж являются учителями средней школы. Заработная плата у учителей маленькая и не хватает на содержание семьи. Для этого вот уже более 10 лет они дополнительно занимаются сушкой абрикоса и продажей сухофруктов. Также они недавно купили дойную корову, которая является дополнительным источником для их семейного бюджета. Санавбар хотела бы получить займ для покупки сухофруктов с целью увеличения товарооборота. Дополнительный прибыль поможет ей в осуществления ее давней мечты, проведение свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Sanavbar is married.  She has three children.  She and her husband are high school teachers.  Teaching salaries are small and there is not enough money to support a family.  So for more then 10 years they also dry apricots and sell dried fruits.  Also they recently purchased a dairy cow which is an additional source of income for their family.  Sanavbar would like to take out a loan to buy dried fruits in order to increase her turnover.  The additional revenues will help her to make her long-held dream come to fruition, to hold her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Tsagaanhuu

texts.en: Tsagaanhuu is 55 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband is taxi driver; her two elder children are employed and the youngest is a student. Tsagaanhuu does multiple things for a living. She plants vegetables, feeds six cows and milks them and does tailoring from home. She is very passionate about her work. Lately, she is experiencing a shortage of basic materials for her tailoring business. She is a hardworking and diligent woman. She says: "Some people ask me, "how do you maintain all these things?" I say to them, 'I love to work and that's it.'" She is requesting MNT 1,500,000 to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 34 years old. He is married to Catherine and they are blessed with one child. Joshua runs an electronic shop as well as a barber shop in the area of Kibera at Biashara Center where most of his clients are men. He has been in business for the last three years and earns an income of KES 20,000 per month.

He is applying for his first loan of KES20,000 from KADET LTD. He plans on using the full amount of this loan to purchase a stock of extensions, mobile chargers and mobile phone accessories. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his child.

Joshua hopes to open a retail electronic shop. He is very hardworking and a promising businessperson.

loans.use: To buy electronics, mobile chargers and mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children. 

Cecilia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages for her shop.

Cecilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cecilia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 44, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a single mother who has two children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Edna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells cooked viands (meals) for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 250 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Edna hopes to be able to expand soon and have her own house, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, toiletries, beverages, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a single, 25 year-old, enterprising businessman. He has been operating a bicycle transport service for the past three years.  He earns a monthly income of KES 8,000, which he uses for his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Peter will use the loan to buy a motorbike to facilitate his transportation. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will save and open a retail shop. His hopes and dreams are to own a private service vehicle which will help improve his living standard and his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to facilitate his transportation

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 21 years old.  She is a married woman with one child who is not in school.  She has a business of selling beans and sugar in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for three years.

Rose requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to enable her to purchase more sacks of beans and sugar for sale.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Koam

texts.en:
Mrs. Koam is 35-year-old married woman who has been resided in Siem Reap province. She is a responsible housewife who takes care of three children. All of her children are getting ready for school, so she has to try hard to earn more income to support their education. 

Mrs. Koam is in the business of making a paste of fermented fish and cultivating vegetable crops. She gets fresh fish from her husband who catches them out of the river and nearby lake. She is able to earn around $4 USD per day through this business.

Mrs. Koam has another skill in making clothes. However, she cannot start and operate this business due to the lack of assets like a sewing machine and other necessary machines. Now she is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy those machines to start running her sewing business. She hopes that she can improve her business, generate more income and make a good standard of living for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and other necessary machines.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for more coffee, sugar, and instant noodles for her coffee stand.

loans.name: Mohinisso

texts.ru: Мохиниссо швея. Она замужем, муж электрик, у них двое детей. У нее небольшой швейный цех и три ученицы. Она занимается пошивом женской одежды. Мохиниссо хочет нанимать больше учениц и таким образом расширить свой бизнес. Поэтому ей необходимо займ для покупки дополнительных швейных машин. Она надеется на вашу помощь, и заранее благодарна вам.
texts.en: Mohinisso is a seamstress.  She is married, her husband is an electrician, and they have two children.  She has a small garment factory and employs three apprentices.  She is involved in sewing women's clothing.  Mohinisso wants to hire more apprentices and, thus, expand her business.  This is why she needs a loan to buy additional sewing machines.  She hopes to receive your help and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase additional sewing machines

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 30 years old. She is married to Payo and they have four children. The husband does agricultural business to supplement the family income.

Elizabeth operates a clothes-selling business and has been doing this kind of work for the last 3 years. She specializes in ready-made clothing. In a month, she generates an income of around 32,200 KES and she hopes to increase this figure since she is taking a second loan from KADET LTD to boost her stock by purchasing more clothing for sale.

She will use the profits to reinvest back into the business and also provide basic needs to the family. Her future dream is to expand her business through bringing more clothing to meet her customers’ tastes.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothing for sale

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married, 45 years of age, and lives in Poblacion Bonifacio Misamis Occidental together with her two kids. Evangeline is operating a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than 5 years and she earns 10,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. Evangeline's business is very stable in her community.  

She joined GDMPC this year. In the future, Evaneline will use her income to support her two kids in their studies until they finish college and also in their daily needs. Evangeline wishes that their business will be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cloths for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 26 years old and a married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Rose requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to order more charcoal for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan for buying a motorcycle in future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rahmatkhoja

texts.ru: Рахматходжа женат имеет троих детей. На протяжении 11 лет занимается обувным ремеслом. Он привозит обувные материалы, кожу и меха. Занимается обработкой и ручным пошивом обуви. Он хочет получить займ для закупа искусственного меха для пошива к зиме зимних сапог, маcхи (национальная обувь). Он надеется получить займ и увеличить объем производства обуви к зиме.
texts.en: Rahmatkhoja is married and has three children.  He has been involved in shoe repair for 11 years.  He brings in shoe materials, leather and fur.  He is involved in treating and hand-sewing shoes.  Rahmatkhoja wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of faux fur for sewing winter boots, maskhi (national shoes), for the winter season.  He hopes to get this loan and increase the volume of shoe production for the winter.

loans.use: to purchase faux fur for sewing winter boots for the winter season

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 25-year-old fisherman living in Talibon, Bohol. He has been a fisherman for 2 years. He is asking for a loan to purchase gasoline, fishing nets and hooks. This will help Christopher continue earning from his business.

Christopher works hard to support his family of a wife and one child.

Christopher hopes to be successful with his business. He also plans to save for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, fishing nets and hooks.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael  is a hardworking entrepreneur, married to Emily, a housewife, and they have three children.

Michael operates a retail shop at Kapune business center and has been doing this for the last year with success since he is able to make a monthly income of KES 16,400. He applied for a loan of KES 60,000, his second loan from  KADET LTD, and will use the money to buy additional stock of daily-use items like sugar, rice and cooking fat for sale.

He will use the profits to plough back into the business and also provide basic needs for his family since he is the sole breadwinner.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of daily-use items for sale.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en: Rodah is a hardworking businesswoman who is 59 years old. She is married and blessed with one child. For the last five years, she has been selling honey to make a living. Her potential customers are passerby and people living in that area. In the next five years, she wants to establish a wholesale business. Rodah is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy honey for resale.

loans.use: To buy honey

loans.name: Rabi

texts.ru: Раби замужем, на воспитании имеет троих детей. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Для содержания детей она занимается сушкой абрикосов. По дешёвой цене она закупает сушеные абрикосы с соседнего города, обрабатывает его и продает. В зимний период продает по высоким ценам. Также оптом закупает сухофрукты у дехкан. Займ она запрашивает на покупку сухофруктов и расширения бизнеса. Раби заранее благодарить всех кредиторов за поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Rabi is married and is raising three children.  Her husband is working in the Russian Federation.  In order to support her children, Rabi is involved in drying apricots.  She buys dried apricots from a neighboring town at a cheap price, processes and sells them.  In the winter, she sells dried apricots at high prices.  Rabi also buys dried fruits wholesale from dekhan farmers.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of dried fruits and expanding her business.  Rabi thanks all creditors in advance for the support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is married and blessed with two children. He has been selling fried fish for the last one year to make a living. He is also employed elsewhere. Hence, he has employed two people to run his business when he is absent. He has been able to retain his business because of good reputation with his customers. With the 20,000 Kenya shillings, he wants to buy ingredient such as cooking fat for frying fish.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Martin dreams of buying a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat for frying fish.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en: Taghreed is a 39 years old woman. She is married with one daughter. Her husband is a Ministry of higher education employee with a decent salary. Taghreed wants to purchase new home furniture and some home appliances such as: living room seating, refrigerator, etc, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for this purchase, so she needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,500 from FATEN. When Taghreed gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase the necessary home furniture and appliances and it would enable her to provide better living conditions for the family. Taghreed is a conservative woman, so her husband Waleed is photographed instead in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture and appliances.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela Minayo is 27 years, married to Elijah who is a businessman, and they have two young children.

Pamela operates a cereal business in Kakamega town and has been doing so for the last five years with success since she makes a monthly income of KES 17,400. She joined KADET LTD, and she has applied for a  loan of KES 20,000 which she will use to buy more cereals like maize and beans  for sale.

She will use the profits to buy still more cereals for sale and her long-term dream is to be the best business lady in Kakamega and own several cereal outlets.

loans.use: To purchase more cereals to stock for the business.

loans.name: Precillar

texts.en: Precillar is single and blessed with one child. For the last 25 years, she has been running a business selling honey to make a living. The major challenge she faces is competition. But she is able to retain her customers because of her good reputation. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to manage her business with her previous loan. With 20,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy honey for resale.

loans.use: To buy honey

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell at a small shop

loans.name: Latif

texts.ru: Латиф женат имеет двоих детей. Для содержания семьи он занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота. Также в сезон занимается торговлей яблок. Имеет хорошие доходы. Он построил себе веранду и хочет получить займ для отделки и ремонта своего дома. Он надеется получить займ и улучшить свое благосостояние.
texts.en: Latif is married and has two children.  In order to support his family, he is involved in fattening up cattle.  He is also involved in selling apples during the season.  Latif built himself a veranda and wants to obtain a loan for finishes and repairs of his house.  He hopes to get this loan and improve his well-being.

loans.use: to make repairs to his house

loans.name: Ronila

texts.en:
Ronila is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Ronila has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ronila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ronila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 25 years old and married with two children who attend school.  To earn a living, he does tailoring.  He has been in the business for five years and has employed four people. He also does farming to supplement his income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business. Charles hopes to open a tailoring school in the future. He has requested 35,000 Kenya shillings to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
This is Leticia, 53, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines, a widow and mother to her four children.  She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
                            
Leticia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also retails electronic cell phone loads for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Leticia hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат разведенная женщина, у нее трое детей. Она работает на заводе по переработке хлопка и за месяц получает заработную плату в размере 700 сомони. Являясь единственной кормильцем в семье она также дополнительно занимается продажей сухофруктов и откормом крупного рогатого скота. В бизнесе ей помогают дети. Сухофрукты востребованы круглый год и у нее большие спросы на продажу сухофруктов. Адолат хотела бы получить займ для приобретения сухофруктов и скота.
texts.en: Adolat is a divorced woman, who has three children.  She works at a cotton-processing factory and earns a monthly income in the sum of 7000 somoni.  Being the sole provider for her family, Adolat is also involved in sales of dried fruits and fattening up cattle.  Her children help her with this business.  Dried fruits are in demand all year around, and she has a lot of requests for sales of dried fruits.  Adolat wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of dried fruits and livestock.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits and livestock

loans.name: Resilene

texts.en:
Resilene is a young mother who has one infant child. She did not pursue college because she got married early. It is difficult for them to move on the first time, because they don't have any profession. Through the help of their parents, she is engaged in a hog-raising business while her husband manages their farm. They aim to earn and save more income to satisfy their needs and save for the future of their child. 

She wants to improve her hog-raising business to increase her income but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her hog-raising business. She mentioned that this loan will be a great help for her to improve her business and make it a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Limon

texts.ru: Лимон женат, имеет двоих детей. Ради содержания семьи. Обучения детей он занимается продажей сухофруктов. Доходы от продажи сухофруктов большие. На доходы он обучает сына. Он хочет получить займ и закупить оптом сухофрукты и на полученные доходы женить сына. Он надеется на одобрение займа.
texts.en: Limon is married and has two children.  In order to support his family and providing education for his children, he is involved in sales of dried fruits.  Income from sales of dried fruits is high.  He uses this income to provide education for his son.  Limon wants to obtain this loan to buy dried fruits wholesale and use the profits to marry off his son.  He hopes to get his loan request approved.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 26 years old, married to Josephine, and blessed with two children, ages 5 and 2. He runs a retail shop and has been in business for three years, with a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

He is borrowing a loan of 10,000 KES to add stock to the business, like two crates of soda, cooking fat, and maize flour.

He plans to pay back his loan with the anticipated profit from the business. This is his first loan. His dream is to own a big shop.

loans.use: to buy two crates of soda, cooking fat, and maize flour

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 24 years old, and married to his wife Phylis who is a housewife. They are blessed with one child. Justine has been buying and selling beans for the last three years, with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

He requests a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), with which he intends to purchase more stock of beans for his business. This is his first loan and his hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To add stock of beans for sale.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
This is Ursula, 46, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to her husband Arnel, a driver, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ursula maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer’s order is bought in with cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 27,000. She will use the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in income as she expands her business.

Ursula hopes to be successful in her business and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is 32 years old. She is married with two children.

Annalyn manages a mini grocery store that sells snacks and beverages and all other items. She has had this business for almost 10 years. She requested a loan for 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more stocks to sell and improve her grocery store.

Annalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks like snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ozodbek

texts.ru: Озодбек энергичный предприниматель . Он разведен. Занимается предоставлением строительных услуг - отделка помещений, кровля крыш. Кроме того у него скот для откорма и дальнейшей продажи. Он хочет получить займ для покупки пиломатериалов и шифера для крыш. Он надеется получить займ для дальнейшей деятельности.
texts.en: Ozodbek is an energetic entrepreneur.  He is divorced.  He is involved in providing construction services, such as interior finishes and roofing.  Besides this, he keeps livestock for fattening up and subsequent sale.  Ozodbek wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of timber and slate for roofs.  He hopes to obtain this loan for future business activity.

loans.use: to buy timber and slate for roofs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new home furniture and change the house windows.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
This is Nelia, 61, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to her husband Herminigildo, a Carpenter, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Nelia maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer’s order is bought in with cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1500 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000. She will use the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in income as she expands her business.

Nelia hopes to be successful in her business and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Dufatanemunda I Group

texts.fr:
Paul est un commerçant âgé de 30ans qui habite  le quartier Nyamugari de la ville de Gitega au centre du pays. Il fait le commerce de haricot et du riz depuis 10 ans. Il est aussi cultivateur. Il a fait ses études jusqu’en 4e année primaire. Il est marié a Claudine et ont ensemble 3 enfants dont 2 étudient.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 300,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de haricots et du riz à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« DUFATANEMUNDA I»
texts.en:
Paul is a 30-year-old merchant who lives in Nyamugari, a district of the city of Gitega in the central regions of the country. He is a member of the community group DUFATANEMUNDA I.

He attended 4 years of primary school. He is married to Claudine and they have three children, two of whom go to school.

Paul has been selling beans and rice for 10 years. He is also a farmer. The loan of 300,000 Burundian francs he is seeking through Kiva will allow him to increase his working capital and buy large quantities of beans and rice to sell and achieve substantial profits.

loans.use: to stock up on beans and rice for resale

loans.name: Lurui

texts.en:
Kurui is 28 years old and married to his wife Stella, who helps in supporting the family. They are blessed with two children, ages 3 and 6 years. He runs a posho mill (a hot, sticky dough made from maize or cassava; like porridge) and he has been in business for three years, with a monthly income of 6,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

He is borrowing a loan of KES 10,000, with which he intends to purchase spare parts for his posho mill. He plans to open a kiosk with the anticipated profit from the business.

This is his first loan, and his hopes and dreams are to improve the life span of his machine and to open a big shop.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en: Hilario is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. Hilario has a shop in which he sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 25,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages, as well as to develop his grocery store. Hilario has been a member of HSPFI since 1997. In the future, Hilario hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is 30 years old. He is married and a father of three children. Edward is a dairy farmer; the business has been in operation for the last five years. This marks his third loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to purchase more cows for his business. The profits generated from the business will be directed towards the repayment of the loan and the gradual expansion of his business. Edward’s dream is to become a milk supplier in his region.

loans.use: purchase more cows

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 27 years old and is a hardworking business man. He sells mobile phone accessories, and has been in this business for nine years. Previously, he was employed as a storekeeper in a spare parts shop. Through his hard work, he has sustained his business in a competitive environment.

Francis has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy mobile phone accessories.

Francis hopes to open other outlets of his business in five years.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 27 years old, married, and has a three-year-old child. To earn a living, he sells plastic containers such as basins, buckets, and water tanks.  Since joining Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money. He has also been trained on business management skills, which have helped him to improve his business.

James has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase basins, buckets, and water tanks. He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy basins, buckets, and water tanks.

loans.name: Delgerbuyant

texts.en: Mr. Delgerbuyant is 23 years old and lives with his wife and son in a house which is located in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He works as an electrician for a construction company. His monthly income cannot meet his necessary expenses. Delgerbuyant wants his son to grow up in good living conditions, so recently he made some adjustments to his house and changed the design of his house's rooms. Now he needs to buy some new furniture for his home. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of new furniture.

loans.use: To cover the cost of new furniture.

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en: Gaudencia is 43 years old. She is married with three children. Gaudencia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 32,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages and to extend her mini grocery store into a bigger one. Gaudencia has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Gaudencia hopes to improve her business as well as her family's way of life.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like snacks, beverages, and more

loans.name: Orbito

texts.en:
Orbito is 47, married, and has only one child. He's been a farmer for almost 22 years. He plants rice and vegetables to sell. He also engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. As a responsible father, he's planned to improve his family's living standard and to give them a better life. He endures the hardships and difficulties he has encountered in life, for he believes that they will lead to successes someday if he continues to work and strive.

Orbito wants to ask for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. He mentioned that through this loan he will raise more pigs and increase his income when he sells them. He hopes that in the future, his family will become financially stable.
