loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 37 years old, married, and has two children in school. He sells stationery to earn a living. He has been in this business for five years and has employed one person. He also does farming to earn extra income for his family. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to improve his business.

Moses has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy books and pens. He hopes to expand his business in five years.

loans.use: to buy books and pens.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 55 years old, married, and blessed with five children. To earn a living, he runs a taxi business. He has been in this business for six years.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has received training in business management skills, which has helped him to improve his business.

Philip has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to service his vehicle. He hopes to grow his business and to become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 31 years old and married to Lornah, who is a businesswoman. They are blessed with two children. He sells motorbike spare parts, and he has been in business for four years. Right now, his monthly income from the business is 6,000 KES.

He is borrowing 40,000 KES, which he intends to use to purchase more spare parts to sell. He plans to expand the business and to repay his loan with the anticipated profit from the business.

This is his second loan, and he successfully repaid his previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 32 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She sells farm fertilizer, animal feed, and provides veterinary services. She has seven years of experience in this business, and has employed two people.  She also does horticultural farming to supplement her income. Beatrice joined Faulu Kenya in order to access business loans easily. She has also gained a lot of knowledge on business management skills.

Beatrice has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and blessed with two children, who are still in school. For the last two years, she has run a beauty salon to make a living. She has employed two people to help her to manage the business. She also sells shoes to earn extra income.

Over the next five years, Christine wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy hair chemicals and braids. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals and braids.

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.ru: Мирзоали женатый,  имеет одного ребенка. На протяжении 11 лет занимается откормом крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Скотоводство приносит хорошие доходы. Мирзоали хочет получить займ для закупа корма и крупного рогатого скота. Он надеется на одобрение  займа.
texts.en: Mirzoali is married and has one child.  He has been involved in fattening up cattle and small livestock for 11 years.  Animal husbandry brings in good earnings.  Mirzoali wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of fodder and cattle.  He hopes to have this loan approved.

loans.use: to buy fodder and cattle

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda  is 51 years old. She is married with 3 children. Yolanda has a shop that sells bread, canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, breads, snacks & beverages, and to develop her stall so that she can attract more customers.

Yolanda has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Yolanda hopes to improve her business and her family's way of life.

loans.use: To purchase more food products like bread and snacks to sell

loans.name: Iteka Group

texts.fr:
Janviere est une commerçante âgée de 50ans qui habite la localité de Rutegama de la Province de Muramvya  au centre du pays. Elle vend divers articles de boutique (savons, huile végétale, produits cosmétiques, souliers pour enfants, riz, haricot, etc) il ya de cela une année. Elle était marchande de fruits avant de commencer cette activité. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée  a Hilaire et ont ensemble 6  enfants qui sont tous a l’école.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 400,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités d’articles de boutique (savons, huile végétale, produits cosmétiques, souliers pour enfants, riz, haricot, biscuits, bonbons, etc.) à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« ITEKA»
texts.en:
Janviere is a 50-year old trader who lives in the town of Rutegama in the province of Muramvya, which lies in the centre of the country. She has been selling various products in her shop (soap, vegetable oil, cosmetics, children's shoes, rice, beans, etc.) for the past year. She was a fruit seller before beginning this business. She went to school up until the 6th grade of primary school. She is married to Hilaire and they have six children together, who are all at school.

She is a member of the Iteka community group.

loans.use: to increase her capital in order to buy large quantities of articles for her shop (soap, vegetable oil, cosmetics, children's shoes, rice, beans, biscuits, sweets, etc) for resale so that she can make a lot of money

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 40-year-old businesswoman from Mariakani. She is married and a mother of three children. She runs a restaurant which has been in operation for the last 11 years. Mary has been a KADET client and this marks her fourth borrowing to finance her business. She plans to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, charcoal, vegetables and cereals for her business. Her dream is to own a hotel.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, charcoal, vegetables and cereals

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 52 years old. She is married with 5 children.
Jocelyn has a store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages and develop her mini store.
Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell like snacks, canned goods, and beverages

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис замужем. Имеет одного ребенка. Она домохозяйка. Но дома она просто так не сидит, у неё свой бизнес. На протяжении пяти лет она занимается откормом скота. Она откармливает крупный и малый рогатый скот. Ей помогает её муж. Вместе они получают хорошие доходы. Следует запастись кормом, но для этого нужны средства. Она хочет получить займ и закупить корм и крупный рогатый скот. Она надеется на вашу поддержку в получении займа.
texts.en: Nargis is married and has one child.  She is a homemaker, but does not just stay home.  She has her own business.  Nargis has been involved in fattening up livestock for five years.  She fattens up cattle and small livestock.  Her husband helps her with this business.  Together, they make a good living.  Nargis needs to stock up on fodder, but needs funds for this.  She wants to obtain this loan and buy fodder and livestock.  She hopes to receive your support in obtaining this loan.

loans.use: to buy livestock and fodder

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is single and owns a small shop that offers tailoring and clothes alterations. She has been running this business for 2 years. She would like the loan to buy new fabrics to offer to her clients. She will be able to establish more business and increase her savings with the profits. She would like to see her business expand and prosper.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics and use them in making clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 21 years old and single. He is well-known in his business of selling various goods such as cosmetics, bread, rice, and biscuits. He has been in this business for about four years and works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. 

Theoneste has requested a loan from the Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more goods such as cosmetics, bread, rice, biscuits, drinks, beans, and other items to resell. If successful, Theoneste hopes that he will earn more profits than he did previously. With these profits, he will keep reinvesting for better financial stability, and will save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, bread, rice, biscuits, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Helen Grace

texts.en:
Helen Grace is 43 years old. She is married with 5 children. Helen Grace has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Helen Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Helen Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her coffee selling business.

loans.name: Maida

texts.en: Maida is single and sells secondhand clothes. She has been running this business for two years, and it has enabled her to sustain her daily life. She would like a loan to buy more used clothes to resell. She will use the profits to make a savings and to reinvest in her business. In the future, she would like to see her business expand and prosper.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en: Eden is 24 years old . She is married with one child. Eden has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages and at the same time she has a bake shop where they personally bake cakes and breads. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages and ingredients for making cakes and breads. Eden has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Eden hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages and ingredients for making cakes and breads

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is single. He has been selling charcoal for the last year. James would like a loan to add volume to the amount of charcoal he sells. This business has helped him solve several problems that he has encountered in his life. He will use the profits to reinvest in his business. In the future he would like to be able to solve all problems in a simple way.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is a hardworking mother who is engaged in a candy making business in their community to generate additional income. She is 41 years old and has four school-age children. Due to financial difficulty, she wants to improve her business to help her husband in financing the education of their children.  It is difficult for them to provide all their school needs due to the high cost of tuition fees and commodities.

In this regard, she aimed to make and produce more candies to sell, but due to inadequate capital she is asking for a loan of PHP30,000 to buy flour, sugar, eggs and plastics for her candy making business. She believes that this loan will help her to produce more candies to sell in their community. She hopes that in the future, she will make her business grow and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs and plastics for her candy making business.

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Абдусамад женат имеет двоих детей. Он занимается на протяжении четырнадцати лет товарами народного потребления. У него свой магазин. Товары он привозит изучая потребность населения. Доходы идут на расширение бизнеса и содержания семьи. Он хочет получить займ для пополнения магазина товарами к зиме и продуктами к праздникам. Он надеется получить займ.
texts.en: Abdusamad is married and has two children.  He has been involved in selling grocery products for fourteen years.  He owns a store and brings in products depending on residents' demand.  The earnings are used for business expansion and supporting his family.  Abdusamad wants to obtain this loan to refill store inventory with goods for the winter and products for the holidays.  He hopes to obtain this loan.

loans.use: to buy products for the winter holidays

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Claude is 31 years old and is married with two children age 4 and 7. He takes care of one additional person who is 8 years old.  He is well-known in the business of fishing and selling small fish. In the picture, he is in front of others at the market, in a black T-shirt.  He has been in this business for about 15 years, and his business hours are from 7 a.m until 8 p.m every day. He currently employs five people to help him. 

Claude has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a new boat for his fishing business. If successful, Claude hopes that he will earn more profits than previously. He will keep reinvesting these profits for better financial stability in the future, and save for his children's school fees. He will also be able to renovate his house.

loans.use: To expand his fishing business by buying new boat.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is engaged and has one child, 12 years old, who she adopted. She has been running a hair salon for the last four years. She would like a loan to buy new equipment for the salon in order to see her business prosper. The loan will also be used to start her side business of selling mobile air time cards. This business has helped her provide for her family. With the profits she will make a savings for her future. She would love to see her business grow and prosper.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products to use in her salon.

loans.name: Tunamerimwe Group

texts.fr:
Anesie est une commerçante âgée de 40ans qui habite au centre ville de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce de la bière il ya de cela 18 ans. Elle faisait le commerce des articles divers de boutique (savons, dentifrices, biscuits, etc) avant de commencer cette activité. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée  a Bernard, un cultivateur et ont ensemble 5  enfants dont 4 sont a l’école.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 300,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bière à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TUNAMERIMWE».
texts.en:
Anesie is a 40-year-old merchant who lives in downtown Gitega, a city in the center of the country. She's been selling beer for 18 years. Before that, she used to sell various products, such as soaps, toothpaste, biscuits, etc.

She attended elementary school up to the 6th grade. She's married to Bernard, a cultivator, and they have five children together, out of whom four attend school.

She's seeking a loan of BIF 300'000 to bolster her working capital in order to purchase large quantities of beer for resale and turn a high profit.

She's a member of TUNAMERIMWE Group.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of beer

loans.name: Peninnah

texts.en:
Peninnah is 54 years old and a single mother of two.  To earn a living, she sells cereals.  She has been in the business for six years and has employed one person.  Apart from selling cereals, she practices farming to supplement her income.  Previously, she used to sell clothes.

She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future. Peninnah needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy maize, beans and rice.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans and rice.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 31 years old and married to a primary school teacher.  He has two children who are in school.  To earn a living, he supplies bread and cakes in crates.  He also sells sugarcane to earn extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money and access business loans. 

Alexander hopes to expand his business in five years.  He needs 20,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of bread and cakes.

loans.use: To add to his stock of bread and cakes.

loans.name: Mushtaq

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and the father of three children.

Mushtaq has been the owner of a food market since 2000, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to purchase a diesel generator and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to make more profits to give him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase a diesel generator and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
She is a woman with courage and the mother of five children. Leticia is 56 years of age and already a widow. Her husband died two years ago, but Leticia did not lose her hopes to live happy. Her children are her inspiration to move on and continue to live.

With the help of her children, at her age, Leticia can still manage her rice farming business well. She dreams of having her own savings. She doesn’t want to rely only on her children, because someday her children will be having their own families. 

Leticia’s earnings from each crop was not enough to sustain the needs of her farm for the next crop. Thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP27,000 to buy farm supplies like rice seeds, fertilizers and herbicides that she will use in rice farming. The loan will be a big help toward enabling her to provide the farm supplies she needs. She wishes to gain a higher income to obtain her desires.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like rice seeds, fertilizers and herbicides that will be used in rice farming.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is single. He works as a repairman for machines, radios, and television. He would like a loan to upgrade his business and buy more tools and equipment. Claude will use the profits to establish new products and create a savings for his future. He dreams to become the best entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy more tools used for repairing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for her ducks and fertilizers

loans.name: Sadbaroi

texts.ru: Садбарой замужем, имеет двоих детей. На протяжении 11 лет занимается продажей разных промышленных товаров. У нее свой магазин. Доходы идут на содержание семьи. Любая женщина хочет улучшения благосостояния в семьи и старается внести свой вклад в это дело. Займ она хочет получить для увеличения объема и расширения ассортимента товаров в магазине к Новому году и празднику Иди Курбон. Она надеется в поддержке и получении займа.
texts.en: Sadbaroi is married and has two children.  She has been involved in selling various household products for 11 years.  She has her own store.  The earnings go toward supporting the family.  Any woman wants to improve the well-being of her family and tries to contribute to this process.  Sadbaroi wants to obtain this loan to increase the volume and to expand the assortment of merchandise in her store for the New Year's and Idi Kurbon holiday.  She hopes to get the support in obtaining this loan.

loans.use: to increase volume and expand goods assortment for the holidays

loans.name: Sandrine

texts.en: Sandrine is single but hopes to get married in the near future. She has adopted two children ages 4 and 9. She sells beauty products in a store that she has been running for 9 years. She would like this loan to buy a more diverse inventory for her store. Sandrine hopes to make profits that she will put towards savings for her future.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for sale.

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 55 years old, married, and a father for five children, one of whom works.

Since 2009, Hamid has been an owner of a laboratory for desalination and water purification. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation, and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $1,500 loan in order to change the filters for the maintenance of the system. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to change the filters for the maintenance of the system.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase blankets, jeans, shirts, dresses, and shoes for resale

loans.name: Isam

texts.en: Isam is a 27-year-old man. He has a clothing store, which has many loyal customers. He wants to make a bulk purchase of winter clothes to have a better new collection for sale. But the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for the purchase, so he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Isam gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase a collection of new winter clothes so that he can compete with others and increase his income. This will enable him to live in better conditions and improve his store.

loans.use: to purchase a new winter collection of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela wos born in 1957 in Yerevan. She lives with her husband. Anzhela’s daughter is married and lives with her family separately from her parents. Anzhela’s son lives and works in the Russian Federation and shares his family expenses in Yerevan. 

Anzhela has a higher education and she used to work as a Teacher of Physical Education in school. However, she and her husband found that it was too hard to support her family solely on their salaries, which were not high, so they decided to run their own business.

For more than six years, Anzhela and her husband engaged in a fruit and vegetable business. They had started their business in stalls, which were separate in different streets in Yerevan. Now, Anzhela rents a shop near their house and sells fruits, vegetables, oil, salt, coffee, sugar, and grains that she buys from the biggest Agricultural markets. The profit from the sales of agricultural products and provision helps Anzhela to support her family and helps to provide for her daughter’s family.

Anzhela asks for a $2,500 loan from Kiva lenders to add to the number of goods she sells and construct display shelves for the shop.

loans.use: To increase the number of goods she sells and construct display shelves for the shop.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru: Санобар замужем имеет четверых детей. В бизнесе ей помогает сын. Вместе они стараются удовлетворять потребности односельчан. У нее свой магазин. Она торгует разными промышленными товарами. Она надеется получить займ и расширить ассортимент своего товара к предстоящим праздникам. Так как она товар приобретает  Душанбе и Истаравшане до закрытия перевала должна успеть закупить товар.
texts.en: Sanobar is married and has four children.  Her son helps her in the business.  Together, they try to satisfy residents' demands.  Sanobar has her own store.  She sells various household goods.  Sanobar hopes to obtain this loan and expand her merchandise selection for the upcoming holidays.  Because she buys her merchandise in Dushanbe and Istaravshan, she needs to buy the merchandise before the closing of the crossing.

loans.use: to expand merchandise selection for the upcoming holidays

loans.name: Domitille

texts.en: Domitille is married and has three children aged 3 to 7 years old. Her husband works as a mechanic. She buys cash crops of sorghum and beans and resells them. She has been doing this for one year and this business has helped her support her family. Domitille would like a loan to add more inventory to her reselling business. She will use the profits to create a savings for her future. She would eventually like to import crops from other countries in order to make bigger profits.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans for resale.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Arlene has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to resell.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Gerlie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

Gerlie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Gerlie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée qui vend des tissus.Elle s'approvisionne dans la capitale et revend ses articles à crédit. Elle exerce ce métier depuis près de dix ans et entretient sa famille avec le produit de ce commerce.Elle sollicite auprés de l'UIMEC un pret de 200000f pour renforcer son fonds de commerce en achetant 10 douzaine de tissu basin.
texts.en:
Ndeye is a married woman who sells fabrics. She gets her supplies in the capital, and resells her items on credit. She's been running this business for nearly ten years, which enables her to provide for her family.

She's seeking a loan of XOF 200'000 from Kiva's partner, UIMEC, in order to bolster her working capital and buy ten dozen of Basin fabrics.

loans.use: to buy ten dozen of Basin fabric

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy blankets, shoes, and refrigerators from South Africa for resale.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 21, married, and has one infant child. Due to the lack of job opportunities, she engages herself in making and selling candies in their community. She sacrifices her time in making candies to take care of her child. Through her patience and sacrifices, she makes and sells candies to earn income that she uses to acquire their basic necessities and also to save some for future emergencies.

She aimed to make and produce more candies to sell, but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for additional capital of PHP10,000 to buy Peotraco (supplier of baking sugars, etc.), plastics, egg whites, sticks and straws for her candy making business.  She believes that she will make her business grow as long she continues to work and make improvements in her business.

loans.use: to buy peotraco, plastics, egg whites, sticks and straws for her candy making business

loans.name: Essoham

texts.fr:
Essoham est un homme âgé de 29 ans. Il est marié à une couturière et n’ont pas encore d’enfants.
Essoham travaille comme revendeur de cartes de recharges depuis 01an. Il sert ses clients de façon ambulante dans les zones de HEDZRANAWOE, ATTIEGOU et achète chez les grossistes à LOME.
Essoham a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharges.  
Dans les prochaines années, Essoham voudrait avoir une boutique pour vendre des crédits, et ajouter d’autres activités complémentaires.
texts.en:
Essoham is a 29-year-old man. He is married to a clothier, and they have no children. He has been working as a retailer of mobile phone recharge cards for a year. He serves his customers by going door to door in the areas of HEDZRANAWOE and ATTIEGOU. He makes his purchases from wholesalers in Lomé, the capital of Togo. 

Essoham has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy some phone cards. In the next few years, he would like to have a shop for selling [mobile phone minutes] and to add on additional complementary businesses.

loans.use: to buy phone recharge cards

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 35 years old, married, and blessed with four children. His wife is a housekeeper and his partner in managing their rice farming business. He has been 15 years in this business. He shared that he was only in his twenties when he learned the activities of farming from his parent. Joel did not get a chance to enter college, and that’s why he strives to give the chance to enter college to his children to finish their studies. Joel believes that education is the key to success.

Joel wishes to increase his farm area to gain a higher yield and higher earnings. Due to insufficient funds, he is not able to make his wish a reality. However, he did not lose his hopes of obtaining his wishes someday. He believes that there is always a right time to obtain them in a right way.

Because of the cost of farm supplies like fertilizer, rice seeds, herbicides and insecticides, Joel decided to borrow a loan of PHP27,000 to buy these supplies needed in rice farming, and to pay labor costs.

loans.use: to buy supplies needed in rice farming, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock like ropes, toilet bowls and electronic load credits.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Judith has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Judith has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Judith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Josephine has a shop that sells firewood and green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of firewood and bananas.

Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of firewood and bananas.

loans.name: Saliori

texts.fr:
Saliou est un homme âgé de 30 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il n’a pas enfants. 
Saliou travaille comme revendeur de produits de premières nécessités(riz, sucre, lait , huile végétale) 03ans. Il achète les produits à Lomé et vend à ses clients dans une boutique de la place.
Saliou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en: Saliou is a 30-year-old man. He is married to a retailer and has no children. He has been working as seller of staple foods (rice, sugar, milk, vegetable oil) for three years. He purchases his goods in Lomé, the capital of Togo, and sells to his customers in a local store. Saliou has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy grocery items.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.

Evelyn makes and peddles snacks like rice cakes, cheese cakes, & banana cue (deep-fried banana covered with caramelized brown sugar). She has had this business for five years. She requests a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy traditional cloth and some sewing supplies

loans.name: Ma. Susana

texts.en:
Ma. Susana is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Ma. Susana has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from Natasha & MSE. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more product stock from Natasha & MSE.

Ma. Susana has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ma. Susana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy supply stock from Natasha & MSE.

loans.name: Ndeye Rama

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une jeune femme célibataire qui a décidé de se lancer dans le transport urbain.Elle sollicite ainsi un pret de 400000f pour acheter une motocyclette "Djakarta".Celle ci étant le principal moyen de transport dans sa localité, elle pourra rapidement générer des bénéfices qui lui permettront de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses alimentaires, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.Son ambitiopn est d'arriver à acheter cinq motos de transport.
texts.en: This borrower is a single young woman who decided to get into urban transport. She is thus requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to buy a small motorcycle of the "Djakarta" brand. This is the principal means of transport in her locality. She will be able to generate profit quickly which will allow her to help cover her family's expenses for food, healthcare, and school fees. Her ambition is to manage to buy five transport motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy a "Djakarta"-brand motorcycle.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Edna has a shop that sells home products like plates, spoons, and casseroles. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy products like casseroles, spoons, and plates for resale.

Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy prodcuts like casseroles, spoons, and plates for resale.

loans.name: Adjignon

texts.fr:
Adjignon est une femme  âgé(e) de 30 ans. Elle est célibataire  et a 01 enfant en charge.
Adjignon est revendeuse de friperie (habits importés de l’occident) depuis 2003. Elle vend au marché de HEDZRANAWOE et achète au même lieu.
Adjignon a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des friperies. 
Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer un avenir radieux à son enfant.
texts.en:
Adjignon is a 30 year old woman.  She is single and has one child in her care. 
Adjignon has been selling second-hand clothing (imported from the west) since 2003.  She sells at the market in Hedzranawoe and buys at the same place. 
Adjignon received her loan through WAGES in order to buy second hand clothing.
She says that, with the profits, she foresees being able to assure a bright future for her child.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Rosalinda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 21,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to resell.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 37-year-old man from Mariakani. He is married. John runs a welding workshop, which has been in operation for the last three years. He was recently introduced to KADET LTD and this marks his first loan.

John plans to use the loan to purchase more spare parts for his business. The profits that will be generated from the business will be directed into the repayment of the loan and gradual expansion of his business. John’s dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts.

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr:
Akuvi est une femme âgé(e) de 35 ans. Elle a 01 enfant en charge.
Akuvi travaille comme revendeuse de chaussures depuis 2007. Elle vend au marché de HEDZRANAWOE après achat au même lieu.
Akuvi a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des chaussures pour répondre à la  demande. Elle veut utiliser les profits supplémentaires pour augmenter son stock.
Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer un avenir meilleur à son enfant.
texts.en:
Akuvi is a 35-year-old woman. She has one child to support. She has been working as a retailer of footwear since 2007. She makes her sales at the HEDZRANAWOE market after purchasing her supplies at the same market. 

Akuvi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy shoes in order to meet the demand. She wants to use the extra profit to increase her inventory of goods. She says that, with the profits, she plans on ensuring a better future for her child.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Virgen del Pilar se formó gracias a la ayuda de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en la zona. Actualmente está integrado por 15 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de obtener mayores ingresos para ellas y para sus familiares.
Una de las miembros es la señora Inocencia, ella tiene una despensa, la cual explota desde hace ya un tiempo, por medio de este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante e ir creciendo de forma progresiva y llegar a lo que hoy tiene. En cuanto a su clientela, comenta que la tiene bien formada, ya que muchas personas van hasta su tienda.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, lácteos, panificados y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee called “Virgen del Pilar” formed thanks to help from another committee working in the same zone.  It has 15 members, all women who are friends and neighbors.  They joined together to obtain higher income for themselves and their families.

One of the members is Inocencia.  She has a grocery store that she’s been running for some time now.  Through this work she’s been able to get ahead and to progressively grow until attaining what she has to date.  Her clientele is well-established since many people come to her store.  She’s asking for the loan to buy foodstuffs, dairy products, baked goods and others to stock up and be able to satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: to buy beverages, foodstuffs and others.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan produces doors, windows and overhangs. He needs to make some financial investments to purchase new machines for production. With new machines he will be able to make the production process more effective and make products with more quality. This is very important for him to meet his clients' demands and attract new ones. The development of his business will help Vardan to increase the business income and ensure a brighter future for his family. Vardan lives together with his wife and two sons.

loans.use: to pay for new production machines.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children.

Rosa has a shop that sells home products like bedsheets, tablecloths, and curtains. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of bedsheets, pillowcases, and curtains to sell.

Rosa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of bedsheets, pillowcases, and curtains.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
His name sounds like a girl's name. Joy is 33 years old, married with two school-aged children. He is lucky to be married to a teacher named Nory. Joy is a farmer in the Philippines. He has been running a rice farming business for almost 16 years. With his expertise in farming, Joy earns an average income of P40,000 per crop.

Despite hindrances he encounters in farming, like calamities and pests, Joy still prefers to continue his business because it is the primary source of income of the family. Joy wants to get a better yield for every crop. He visits his farm every other day to assure that his crop is in good condition.

Joy is requesting a loan of P35,000 to purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and to pay for the labor of land preparation. He hopes to used the loan wisely and that it will help him to provide the farm inputs needed in farming.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and to pay for the labor of land preparation.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi est une femme âgé(e) de 44ans. Elle est mariée å un technicien. Elle a 02 enfants.
Essi travaille comme revendeuse de condiments (tomates, piment, oignons) depuis 2003 au marché de NUKAFU. Elle achète à DJABLE (une localité située à quelques kilomètres de la ville de LOME).
Essi a requis son troisième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter d’augmenter son stock en achetant plus de condiments.. 
Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit aider son mari dans les charges de foyer  et assurer un avenir radieux à ses 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Essi is a 44-year-old woman who is married to a technician. She has two children. She has been working as a seller of condiments (tomatoes, chili peppers, onions) since 2003 at the NUKAFU market. She makes her purchases in DJABLE (a town located a few kilometers from the city of LOME). 

Essi has requested her third loan from WAGES to increase her stock by buying more condiments. She says that, with the profits, she plans on helping out her husband in covering household expenses and ensuring a shining future for her two children.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 19 years old, single, and she does not support anybody in the family. She runs a boutique, and she has been in business for one year. Right now her monthly income from the business is KES. 30,000.

She is borrowing KES. 50,000 with which she intends to purchase more clothes for sale. She will plough all the anticipated profits back into the business. 

This is her second loan and she successfully paid her previous loan. Her hopes and dreams are to continue being an entrepreneur or self employed.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and washing detergents to sell

loans.name: Shushan

texts.en: Shushan is engaged in agricultural business. Shushan lives together with her husband and it's hard for them to cultivate the land themselves. Thus she has to hire workers to do the job. With the help of this loan Shushan plans to pay the hired workers, as well as to purchase fertilizier and fuel. Successful cultivation of the land will allow Shushan to get good harvest and develop agriculture. This also means improved living conditions for Shushan's family.

loans.use: to pay the hired workers and to purchase fertilizier and fuel.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en: Sergey sells fruits and vegatables from a rented booth. Sergey would like to enlarge his business and increase his working capital. With the requested loan Sergey plans to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell. Increase of sales will allow Sergey to develop his business and get additional income, which is very important for him to sustain his family. Sergey lives with his wife and two daughters.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is 28 years old and still single. He supports a family of three members. Wilfred buys and sells tea leaves from the local suppliers and sells them to the nearby tea factory for processing. He has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES.10,000.

He has opted to borrow a loan of KES.35,000 from KADET LTD  as his second loan, after he repaid the previous one successfully. He wishes to use this amount to increase the quantity of tea for resale. The profits will be used to plough back to business and repay back the loan.

His dream is to excel in business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves from local suppliers to sell

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is in his fifties. He is a farmer in the Philippines, planting two hectares of rice. According to him, his business has been a big help for him and to his family. His income from the business provides their food every day. 

Rodolfo has been 25 years in the business. His income depends on the climate, but he declares that most of his income comes from his crops, ranging from P40,000 to P60,000 per crop. Rodolfo has no other source of income that would help him in providing his needs in farming. Therefore, he is requesting a loan amounting to P42,000 to buy rice seeds to grow and fertilizers and herbicides for plant care.

Rodolfo wishes to gain higher income from the business and will have his own savings. As he said, he is getting older. He wants to have savings for the preparation for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds to grow and fertilizers and herbicides for plant care.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is 30 years old and a married woman with three children, three of whom are in school. Her husband is a driver. She has a business selling ice cream in Buluk, South Sudan, and has been in this business for six years.

Amal requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more ice creams for sale. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ice cream for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and sprays for his crops

loans.name: Alina

texts.en: Alina is engaged in beekeeping. She would like to enlarge her business, for which she needs some financial investments. With the requested loan, Alina plans to purchase beehives. An increase in beehives will allow Alina to receive and sell more honey, which is very much demanded, not only in her town, but also in the region. Alina will also increase her business income and insure a sustainable future for her family. Alina lives together with her husband and children.

loans.use: to pay for beehives.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito is 49 years of age, married and has four children. Carlito’s wife is a housekeeper. Carlito is a farmer planting three hectares of rice in the Philippines. He is almost 23 years in this type of business. Carlito’s goal in life is to uplift his family's  standard of living.

Carlito’s one way to uplift his family's standard of living is to strive and work hard and love his work, which is farming. Carlito's income from the business goes for the education of his children. He knows that he has no other treasure to give his children other than education.

Carlito is requesting a loan of P50,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and pay for labor and land preparation. He hopes to access the loan and he will use it wisely for the better future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and pay for labor and land preparation.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is married with one child who is three years old. Her husband works at a storage warehouse. She sells used clothes in a store that she has been running for seven years. She would like a loan in order to increase her inventory of clothes. 

Vestine will use the profits to support her family and reinvest in her business. Her dream for her business is to have a prosperous clothing store with many choices for her customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Maryseller

texts.en:
Maryseller is 29 years old, married to Moses, and they have one child. She has operated a restaurant for the last two years, with a monthly profit of KES 15,000.  

Maryseller was introduced to KADET LTD by a group of registered clients with KADET LTD, and she is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD, after paying her previous loans well and in good time. She will use the loan to buy stocks of sugar, wheat flour and maize flour. 

Maryseller will save the anticipated profits and pay school fees for her child. In the future she hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 48 years old, married to an accountant and has four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in bulk in South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.
Victoria has requested this loan through Kiva partner, BRAC South Sudan, to order for more charcoal for resale. She will use her profits to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mayah

texts.en:
Mayah is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 
Mayah has a shop that sells home appliances such as electric irons, fans and rice cookers. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy stock such as electric fans, electric irons and rice cookers.
Mayah has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock such as electric fans, electric irons and rice cookers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and drinks for her shop.

loans.name: Marceline F B

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une jeune femme mariée qui exerce l'activité de commerce de tissus. Elle achéte son produit chez des grossistes et le revend à crédit à ses clients.Les revenus de son activité lui permettent de se prendre en charge mais aussi de prendre en charge ses enfants.A l'approche des fetes,elle sollicite un pret de 100000f pour acheter des tissus basins, des parfums et des habits pour enfants.Son ambition est de s'installer dans une cantine au marché central.
texts.en: This borrower is a young married woman who sells fabric. She buys her products from wholesalers and sells on credit to her customers. The income from her business allows her to cover her own expenses and also those of her children. As the holidays are coming soon, she is asking for a loan of 100,000 francs to buy damask cloth, perfume, and clothing for children. Her ambition is to get a little shop in the central market.

loans.use: to buy damask cloth, perfume, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul, who is 28 years old, married, and blessed with a two-year-old child, has been selling shoes to earn a living for four years now.  He also sells eggs to supplement his income.  Through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya, Paul has gained knowledge in business management, and this has helped him to improve his business. Now requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoes, Paul hopes to open other outlets for his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children, renovate his house, and invest in business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. Rebecca has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, detergents, soaps and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 21,000 to buy soaps, detergents, snacks and beverages. Rebecca has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy soaps, detergents, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new home furniture to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jubboo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 28 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Rose qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 52 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes, d'arachides et de l'eau fraiche. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on May 28, 2001. It is comprised of fifteen women who live in the same district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. Ms. Rose, the one at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's official. She is 52 years old and a married mother of eight children. She also supports two other children, who were entrusted to her by her parents. 

Ms. Rose is active in selling vegetables, peanuts, and chilled water. She has good experience in this business domain. She has been working in it for several years. 

This loan will enable her to bolster her capital and to develop her businesses further. The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health care, food, clothing, etc. ...) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and vegetables

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a 36-year-old businessman. To earn a living, he runs a butcher shop.  He has been in the business for two years and has employed one person.  Through the training sessions conducted by Faulu Kenya, he has gained knowledge on business management skills.  This has helped him to improve his business.

Jacob hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future. He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy meat.

loans.use: To buy meat.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. Rosario has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 21,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Rosario has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rosario hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 13 years. He is 42 years old, married to Mary, and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

In future, Jeremiah hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 44 years old, married and has three children.  To earn a living, he runs a general store.  He has three years of experience in the business and has employed one person.  He also practices farming to earn extra income for his family.  He has retained his customers in a very competitive environment because of his good customer care.

Geoffrey hopes to grow his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy 50 kilos of sugar, sodas, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy 50 kilos of sugar, soda, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: L"emprunteur est un tailleur marié et pere de quatre enfants.Il exerce cette activité depuis pres de 15 ans.Il a démarré avec une seule machine et a beacoup travaillé pour acquérir un local trés bien placé et trois machines à coudre.Sa clientèle a beaucoup augmenté et cela lui procure des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille.Il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter une nouvelle machine  à coudre  beaucoup plus moderne et plus performante.Son ambition est d'ouvrir un centre de formation des jeunes au métier de tailleur.
texts.en: This borrower is a married tailor and the father of four children. He has been in his trade for almost 15 years. He started out with only one sewing machine and has worked long and hard to acquire a workshop that is well-located and three sewing machines. His clientele has grown a lot and that brings him in income that allows him to support his family. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy a new, more modern and more efficient sewing machine. His ambition is to start up courses to teach young people the tailor's trade.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy detergents, soaps and canned goods.

loans.name: Kai's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is a group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, based in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone, to apply for a loan of 3,100,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, they will be able to solve their immediate financial needs and then gradually repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. 

Kai is the leader of this group of teachers. He was born in Manjamadu, in eastern Sierra Leone. Kai is 45 years old and he is married with 5 children – 3 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. Kai has been a professional teacher for 7 years now. He has applied for this loan in order to buy household furniture and house building materials for the rehabilitation of his house.

loans.use: to buy household furniture and house building materials for the rehabilitation of his house.

loans.name: Ihssan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married and a father of one child.

Ihssan has been an owner for a bookshop since 2003. He has a photocopier in his shop and he sells stationery. He has more than eight years' experience in this field and a good reputation. He is becoming well known, and his shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a lot of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $2000 loan in order to purchase a color photocopy machine and to add more merchandise. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a color photocopy machine and to add more merchandise.

loans.name: Sukkar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married and a father of five children.

Sukkar has been an owner of a store since 2005, selling household items and repairing satellite. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. He is becoming well known, and his shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a lot of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $1500 loan in order to renovate his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new home furniture and appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more rental houses.

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Herman is 49 years old, married, and has four children.  To earn a living, he sells kerosene.  He has been operating this business for one year.  Besides, he is employed.  He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for training him on business management skills.  This has helped him to improve his business.

Herman’s desire is to expand his business and open other outlets.  He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to use as capital to start selling eggs.

loans.use: to start an egg-selling business.

loans.name: Rassem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married, and the father of one child.

Rassem has been an owner of a food market since 2005. He sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese, dairy products, and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for $1,500 in order to tile the walls of his market with cermaic and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to tile the walls of his market and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. Teresita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sanime

texts.en: Sanime is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Sanime has a pigpen and sells matured and grown pigs. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Sanime hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Jeliah

texts.en:
Jeliah is 35 years old, married, and blessed with two children.  She sells pumpkins to earn a living.  She has been in this business for four years.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her money and access a business loan easily.  She has also witnessed a lot of growth in her business.  This has helped her to educate her children.

Jeliah hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy pumpkins and bananas.

loans.use: to buy pumpkins and bananas.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Elvie has a shop that sells accessories, toys and clothing. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy stocks of accessories, toys and clothing. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elvie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of accessories, toys and clothing

loans.name: Cristina Lyne

texts.en: Cristina Lyne is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a shop that sells fish like sardines, mackerel and salmon. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fish to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cristina Lyne hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more accessories and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Remely

texts.en: Remely is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Remely has a shop that sells hammers, hand gloves and weighing scales. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy stocks of hammers, gloves and weighing scales. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Remely hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of hammers, gloves and weighing scales.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Bonface is married and blessed with two children. He has been practicing dairy farming for the last two years to make a living. Previously, he was managing a retail shop. He has employed one person to help him manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Bonface is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eggs, food seasonings and spices.

loans.name: Arsenita

texts.en:
Arsenita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Arsenita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Arsenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Arsenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new home furniture to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Rosalinda has a shop that sells spices, food seasonings and vegetables, such as eggplants and string beans. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy spices, food seasonings and vegetables.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, food seasonings, and vegetables.

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en:
Chrispine is married and a father of three.  It has been one year since he started practicing poultry farming.  He has employed one person in the business.  He has grown the business with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya.  His desire is to farm on a large scale in five years.
Chrispine has requested 35,000 Kenya shillings to buy chicken feed and chicks.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Annabelle has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and meats, such as chicken and pork adobo, a marinade dish, and caldereta, a stew. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy the raw ingredients needed to cook meats.

Annabelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Annabelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking meats.

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
Rodulfo is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Rodulfo is providing motorcycle or "habal-habal" services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

Rodulfo has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rodulfo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Elvita

texts.en:
Elvita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Elvita has a food shop that sells "halo-halo" or flavored ice. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy raw ingredients for making "halo-halo" or  flavored ice.

Elvita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Elvita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making "halo-halo"  (flavored ice).

loans.name: Margo

texts.es:
Margo, nuevamente esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, en esta ocacion comprara huevos para vender, ropa como blusas pasa damas, faldas, vestidos, ya que es demanda por sus clientes, esta compra le ayudara a crecer en el negocio y tener la mercadería necesaria para atender a la clientela.
Su inversion anterior le ayudo ha librarse de un negocio bajo, porque con este fondo logro la compra oportuna de ropa y pollos, permitiendole mejorar su condicion y pagar oportunamente las cuotas.
texts.en:
Margo is once again requesting a loan to buy merchandise.  On this occasion she’ll buy eggs to sell and clothes like women’s blouses, skirts and dresses which her customers are asking for.  This purchase will help her business grow and to have the necessary merchandise on hand to meet customer demand.

Her previous loan helped her overcome a low period because she was able to use the funds to buy clothes and chickens in an opportune way allowing her to improve her condition and to make her installment payments on time.

loans.use: to buy eggs and clothes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 47 years old, a married woman with five children, all five of whom are in school. She has a business as a clothes sewer in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for seven years. Her husband works as a civil servant.

Grace requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase a sewing machine. She will use her profits from this loan to build a permanent house in future.

loans.use: to purchase  more cloth to sew.

loans.name: Green Group

texts.en:
Andrew is a 51-year-old married man with four children aged 29, 27, 23, 20 and 19.  One child is still of school-going age. Andrew lives in Shurugwi town which is about 30km away from the city of Gweru. 

He raises poultry. The business has been in existence since 1984. His business lacks funding, thereby impacting negatively on the sales. He has a loan of $400 which has helped him buy about 250 chicks. He intends to open a restaurant where he will be serving meals with chicken if all goes well .He will be also in  a position to continue sending his child to school with the proceeds from the business.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and medicines.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Esterlita has a shop that sells vegetables like tomatoes, eggplants & cabbages using the multipurpose cab. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy a variety of vegetables.

Esterlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Esterlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with eight children. 

Arceli has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, soaps & sugar per kilogram. She has had this business for  five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, soaps, toothpaste & sugar per kilogram.

Arceli has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Arceli hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soaps, toothpaste & sugar per kilogram.

loans.name: Sindi Guadalupe

texts.es:
Sindi, vive con su mamá y dos hijos, es casada, es costurera, este negocio lo inicio gracias a su propia iniciativa, el trabajo lo aprendió en una academia, trabaja todos los días de 7:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de telas, zipper, botones, hilos y otros materiales para la costura, esta compra le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio, a tener buenas ganancias y a si poder ayudar a cubrir los gastos familiares.  
Su mayor sueño es mejorar su negocio, para con ello mejorar sus ganancias y darles el estudio a sus hijos hasta la universidad.
texts.en:
Sindi lives with her mother and her two children.  She’s married and is a seamstress.  She started this business on her own initiative having learned the occupation at an academy.  She works every day from 7am until 6pm.

She’s asking for the loan to buy fabric, zippers, buttons, thread and other sewing supplies.  This purchase will help her strengthen the business.  Having good profits will help her cover family costs.

Her greatest dream is to improve her business to earn better profits to provide her children with education all the way through university.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, thread and zippers.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Leonora has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Leonora has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Jonna

texts.en:
Jonna is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Jonna has a shop that sells soaps, detergents & snacks. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy soaps, detergents & snacks.

Jonna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jonna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy soaps, detergents & snacks.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with four children who are aged 3 to 10 years old. Her husband works as a security guard. Rose sells foodstuffs in her store which she has run for seven years. She has a high volume of customers and would like a loan to buy more products to meet the high demand. With the profits she would like to put aside savings for her future and increase capital for her business. Rose would love to see her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and make more profits.

loans.name: Emigdio De Jesus

texts.es:
Emigdio, vive con su mamá y sus hermanos, es soltero, agricultor y ganadero, dicho negocio surgió gracias a sus padres que le enseñaron el oficio y lo apoyaron para sacar adelante el negocio, trabaja todos los días a tiempo completo.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semilla mejorada, herbicidas, abono, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar sus cosechas y sus ingresos económicos.
Su mayor sueño es obtener buena cosecha, ser un agricultor en grande y vivir tranquilamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Emigdio lives with his mother and siblings.  He’s single.  He’s a farmer and raises livestock.  This business arose thanks to his parents who taught him the occupation and supported him to move the business forward.  He works every day, all day in the fields.

He’s asking for a loan to buy farming supplies like improved seeds, herbicides and manure.  This purchase will help him improve his crops and his income.  His greatest dream is to obtain a good harvest, to be a great farmer and to live in peace with his family.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds, herbicides and manure.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is married with four children aged from 11 to 16 years old. His wife works as a house cleaner. Bernard sells fabrics in his store which he has run for 16 years. He would like a loan to buy a bigger variety of fabrics. Bernard also makes clothes and does tailoring as a source of extra income. He will use the profits to buy more tailoring machines so that he can grow his business. He would someday like to have a school where he can teach others how to make clothes.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Remedios has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Remedios has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Remedios hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Elisa has a shop that sells souvenir products like necklaces & table cloths at the same time displays weighing scale for sale. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy raw materials to make souvenirs to sell.

Elisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make souvenirs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy concrete posts and cylone fencing.

loans.name: Jacqueline Marisol

texts.es:
Jacqueline es un ejemplo de superación, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su abuela de 65 años de edad en casa de un familiar. Desde que tiene 6 años de edad viven juntas, ya que sus padres se divorciaron y cada uno decidió formar un nuevo hogar.

Ella trabaja como empleada domestica desde hace 6 años, con una familia que viven en la misma colonia donde ella vive. Durante todo este tiempo a tenido que estudiar por las noches en un centro educativo de la ciudad, actualmente ella esta por terminar su bachillerato por lo que esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para cancelar los gastos de graduación como lo son: el comprarse una ropa adecuada para la ocasión, pagar las fotografías, pago de derecho de graduación y de la celebración, pago del diploma. Con esto ella podrá sentirse satisfecha y muy contenta de haber logrado una etapa más en su vida de superación y celebración de su triunfo.

Jacqueline tiene muchas expectativas hoy que será bachiller, ya que tendrá la posibilidad de trabajar como vendedora de mostrador en una farmacia, ya que tendrá más tiempo disponible y con el nuevo empleo podrá tener acceso a las prestaciones sociales y mejorar su nivel de vida. Cuando no había terminado aun el bachillerato fue a una entrevista en esa empresa, pero los horarios no se ajustaban a su horario de escuela, pero hoy que termina el bachillerato podrá trabajar en esa empresa, en la cual puede tener la oportunidad de asistir a la universidad y superarse cada día más.
texts.en: Jacqueline is an example of excellence, she is 23 years old, unmarried and lives with her grandmother, who is 65 years old, in a relative's home. Since she was 6 years old they have been living together, since her parents divorced and each decided to form a new home.  For 6 years she has been working as a domestic employee with a family living in the same neighborhood where she lives. During this time she had to study at night in a city school, she is currently completing her high school diploma and is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo, to cancel graduation expenses, such as: buying appropriate clothing for the occasion, to pay for the photographs, fees and graduation celebration payment and the diploma. With this she will be able to feel satisfied and very happy having reached another stage in life of excellence and celebration of her triumph. Today Jacqueline has high expectations that she will be a graduate since she will have the opportunity to work as a saleswoman at a pharmacy counter as she will have more time available and with the new job she will have access to social benefits and improve her standard of living. When she was not even finished with high school she went to an interview at the company but the schedule did not fit her school schedule.  Now that has her diploma she can work in that company and she has the opportunity to attend college and succeed every day.

loans.use: to pay for graduation expenses such as: purchasing appropriate clothing, paying for photographs, paying for graduation fees, etc

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Anita has a shop that sells firewood & charcoal per sack. She has had this business for 36 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw materials needed for making charcoal.

Anita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Anita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for making charcoal.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
Fabiana es socia del Banco Comunal Urpicha, tiene 53 años, es casada y madre de 5 hijos.
Fabiana es dueña de un salón de billar, ella fue una de las fundadoras de su Banco Comunal al que pertenece desde hace 15 años. Fabiana antes vendía en carretilla golosinas a colegios, se fijó metas de crecer en su negocio y ver lo que mas le conviene, gracias a ello pudo abrir un billar en el cual le va muy bien, ahora con el préstamo que recibirá comprará un carrito sandwichero, una de sus metas es lograr que sus hijos culminen sus estudios superiores.
texts.en: Fabiana is a member of the “Urpicha” communal bank.  She’s 53 years old, married and the mother of five children.  She owns a pool hall.
