She was one of the communal bank’s founding members; she’s been a member of it for 15 years.  Fabiana used to sell snacks at schools from a pushcart.  She set goals to grow in her business and to figure out what was best for her.  Thanks to that she was able to open a pool hall where she does quite well.  Now, with the loan she’ll get she will buy a sandwich cart.  One of her goals is that her children complete higher education.

loans.use: to buy a sandwich cart.

loans.name: Jeffriy

texts.en:
Jeffriy is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Jeffriy is providing motorcycle or "habal-habal" services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Jeffriy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jeffriy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Mohamed M.

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has four children aged 20, 17, 14 and 11. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because he is his nephew. 

 In 1998, Mohamed established his patient medicine business. He began his business because he wants to generate enough income to provide livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy more patient drugs for his drug store. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 310,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to build a dwelling house, buy a car to facilitate his business, and to do international business.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy patient drugs

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo debido a la necesidad de comprar especias para el negocio, este préstamo le servirá muchísimo para tener una mejor variedad y poder atender la demanda de los clientes, su compra será en achiote, cominos, pimientas, hojas secas de laurel, estos materiales son demandados por las amas de casa, para la comida, por lo que esta inversión será muy provechosa.
Él está agradecido porque la inversión anterior, ya que estos aportes le permite crecer en el negocio y ahora cuenta con un medio de transporte, para poder ofrecer a diferentes zonas sus productos, todo lo ha logrado a traves de los prestamos.
texts.en:
Luis is once again requesting a loan because he needs to buy spices for his business.  This loan will be of great help for him to have a wider variety available to meet customer demand.  He will buy annatto, cumin, pepper and dry bay leaves, supplies that are in demand by housewives for their cooking; this is why this investment will be so profitable.  

He’s grateful for the previous investment because it helped his business to grow and he now has a means of transportation to go sell his wares in different zones.  He’s accomplished all this thanks to the loans.

loans.use: to buy spices.

loans.name: Dervina

texts.en:
Dervina is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Dervina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Dervina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Dervina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Edubiges

texts.es:
Edubiges de 42 años es una mujer casada y tiene un hijo de 14 años, con el que sueña verlo convertido en un profesional exitosos. Para ello diariamente se dedica a producir en su negocio ingresos para aportarle al bienestar de su hogar. Sus ideas emprendedoras nacieron hace 15 años cuando empezó a comprar mercancía para luego ofrecerla a vecinas amigas y familiares, su actividad poco a poco creció y así trabajó durante 4 años. Posteriormente le pareció de mayor oportunidad vender queso y vísceras,  pues trabajaba con estos productos en la modalidad de contado,  y así estuvo durante 6 años más. Cuando su esposo empezó a trabajar en una empresa su padre continuó  el negocio y  en el momento en que su cónyuge dejó de trabajar como empleado, retomó su antiguo negocio, pero agregaron arepas asadas, invirtiendo la liquidación que recibió de su empleo, en herramientas, equipos e implementos para desarrollar con éxito esta actividad, como en la actualidad lo hace, aprovechando su cercanía con colegios que son su mayor mercado. 
Su sueño de negocio es tener varios puntos comerciales y por eso   requiere capital de trabajo para comprar un nuevo carro de  arepas que pueda ubicar en un sitio estratégico y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará un nuevo carro de arepas, con el cual generará nuevos ingresos pues ha identificado un potencial mercado en el cual puede extender su jornada de trabajo hasta las horas de la noche, y tendrá éxito pues aplicará toda su experiencia que convertirá en nuevas utilidades.
texts.en:
Edubiges, 42, is a married woman and she has a 14-year-old son who she dreams will become a successful professional.  To accomplish this she focuses on producing income from her business to provide wellbeing for her home.  Her enterprising ideas arose fifteen years ago when she started to buy merchandise to then sell among her friends, neighbors and relatives.  

Her business gradually grew and she worked that way for four years.  Later, she thought selling cheese and offal was a better opportunity since she already sold such items for cash.   She worked that way for six more years.  When her husband started to work for a firm her father continued with the business but when her husband stopped working as a salaried employee she retook her old business but added grilled arepas [A griddle-cake made of soaked corn ground into a paste or dough] investing his severance pay into the business: tools, equipment and implements to successfully carry out this activity.  She’s still in this business taking advantage of being near schools which are her main market.

Her business dream is to have several sales points and this is why she needs working capital to buy a new arepa cart to position strategically and this is why she’s asking for a Kiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy a new arepa cart to generate new income since she’s identified a potential market where she can extend her working hours into the night.  She will be successful because she will apply all her experience to create new profits.

loans.use: to buy a new arepas cart.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Emma has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON.

Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Julio, presenta una nueva solicitud, debido a que le presento desperfectos mecánicos el vehículo,  lo cual debe incurrir en gastos de mecánico y compra de repuestos, Julio no dispone por el momento del suficiente dinero para solventar esta situación que por segunda vez se le presenta, por el aporte economico de los prestamos puede darle el mantenimiento necesario al vechiculo.
El ha mejorado su situación económica con la ayuda de estos préstamos, y del salario que recibe ha cancelado responsablemente las cuotas del anterior.
texts.en: Julio is submitting a new request because his vehicle is having some mechanical problems and he must buy spare parts and pay the mechanic and Julio does not at present have sufficient money to overcome this situation that’s presented itself for the second time.  Money from the loans makes it possible for him to provide the necessary maintenance to his vehicle.  He has improved his economic situation with help from the loans and he was able to pay the installment payments for the previous loan on time using the salary he earns.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to pay a mechanic.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Erlinda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.en:
Ibrahima is originally from West Africa. He has been is the United States since 1997, and when he first arrived he became a truck driver. After a few years on the road, Ibrahima knew he wanted to become more independent and start his own business. Six years ago, he opened a store selling sports apparel and urban style clothing. He says starting a business is all about taking chances, and that’s exactly what he did. With the store, Ibrahima is helping support his wife and three children.

In view of the upcoming cold season, Ibrahima needs to stock the store with warm clothing. He will use this loan to buy inventory such as coats, sweaters, and boots.

loans.use: To purchase inventory such as coats and boots for the upcoming winter.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Mariama.  She is married and has one child aged 13 who is in primary school. In 2005, Mariama established her foodstuffs business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband in taking care of their home. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

Mariama requires a loan in order to buy brown bulgur, white bulgur and corn flour for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Mariama plans to get her own store and to give her child a quality education.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bulgur, corn flour and rice for her business.

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
María, para la remodelación del negocio, solicita nuevamente un préstamo, y lo invertirá en láminas, tubos, alambres, estos materiales serán usados en la ampliación del local.
Estos préstamos le han dado a María, un mejor negocio, con aumentos en las ventas, y en este caso ampliara el local para atender un número mayor de clientes y mejorar así sus ingresos.
El progreso de Maria y de su familia se debe a la buena administracion de los prestamos.
texts.en: María is once again requesting a loan to do some remodeling in her business.  She will buy metal sheeting, tubing and wire that will be used to enlarge the locale.  These loans have improved María’s business; sales have increased.  On this occasion she will enlarge the locale so that she can tend to a larger number of customers and improve her income.  The progress of María and her family is due to the good management of the loans.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, tubing and wire.

loans.name: Makongo  K K Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her late 20s, is married with two children who are still going to school. She has had a retail shop since 2000. She works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to pay school fees, household expenses, and improve her shop's inventory. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase the shop's inventory. Her dream is to one day be able to open another shop in a different place. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Makongo K K" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her shop's inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing like shirts & blouses

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Con su credikiva, don Rigoberto compró plásticos sintéticos al pormayor y fabricó forros de lavadoras computadores e impresoras, con ello aumentó sus ganancias y esta muy satisfecho. En la actualidad aplica a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará Sinteticos para producir mas forros para darle respuesta a su clientela. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente: "Muy agradecido por apoyar a personas de la tercera edad que como yo aun somos productivos. "
texts.en: Rigoberto used his Kiva loan to buy synthetic plastic fabric at wholesale and manufactured slipcovers for washing machines, computers and printers.  He increased profits and is very satisfied.  He is currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy synthetic fabric to make more slipcovers to respond to customer demand.  His message to lenders is the following: “I am very grateful for the support you give to senior citizens like me who are still productive.”

loans.use: to buy synthetic fabric to make more slipcovers.

loans.name: Kula

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Kula. She is married and has three children aged 17, 12, and 9. Living with her also is her sales assistant. In the year 2000, Kula established her foodstuff business. She began her business because she wanted to enhance her independence and to assist her husband in settling some domestic problems. 

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 Leone (SLL) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Kula requires a loan in order to buy brown bulgur, white bulgur, corn flower, and palm oil. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Kula plans to own a larger store, to erect a house and to continue with A.R.D. until she is financially strong. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, corn flower and brown bulgur for her business

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has five children. 

Fernando has a shop that sells firewood & bananas. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more firewood & bananas. 

Fernando has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Fernando hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy firewood & bananas for sell

loans.name: Jackelin Marlene

texts.es:
Jackelin, necesita comprar maíz y gas propano para el negocio, por esta razón se ha decidido a un nuevo préstamo, ya que el anterior le sirvió el realizar esta compra de materiales de una sola vez, generando mejores ganancias.
Estos préstamos le han permitido estabilizar el negocio, y de las ventas poder pagar las cuotas para continuar trabajando. Su Familia se encuentra bien, sus hijos estudiando con el apoyo que ella les brinda.
texts.en:
Jackelin needs to buy corn and propane for the business and this is why she’s decided on a new loan since the previous one made it possible for her to buy these materials all at one time generating better profits.

These loans have allowed her to stabilize her business and be able to make her installments with profits from sales.  Her family is well; her children are going to school thanks to the support she provides them.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has one child. 

Rey is providing habal-habal (motorcycle transport) services. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service. 

Rey has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rey hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service

loans.name: Jose Asencion

texts.es:
José, necesita comprar mercadería, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para seguir creciendo y darle continuidad al buen servicio que brinda a los clientes, su compra será en maíz, carnes, queso, leña, repollo, y gaseosas.
Esta compra le permite tener a disponibilidad de los clientes todo lo necesario para la demanda, estos financiamientos ayudan para el desarrollo del negocio en la obtencion de los comestibles, para preparar los menús.
texts.en: José needs to buy merchandise.  He’s asking for a loan once again to continue growing and provide continuity to the good service he provides his customers.  He will buy corn, meats, cheese, firewood, cabbage and soft-drinks.  This purchase will make it possible for him to have on hand everything necessary to meet customer demand.  These loans help his business develop by obtaining foodstuffs needed to prepare his meals.

loans.use: to buy corn, meats, cheese, firewood, cabbage and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Sao.  She is married and has three children aged 18, 14, and 7. She has two additional dependents who live with her because they are her husband’s relatives.  

In 2004, Sao established her local foodstuffs business. She began her business because she wants to generate enough income to support her family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

Sao requires a loan in order to buy brown bulgur, white bulgur, and corn flour. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Sao plans to own a bigger house and to raise enough money to train her children.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy brown bulgur, Corn Flour, and white bulgur.

loans.name: Ng'oli Associates Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ng'oli Associates Group in Western Kenya, Samwel being the facilitator of the Ng'oli Associates group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Samwel takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to the firm's best services offered to farmers and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Samwel had an excellent maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Samwel was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Samwel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Samwel will invest in livestock rearing and will use the same for loan repayment. 

In 2012, the members of Ng'oli Associates group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture:  
Samwel is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Elsa has a shop that sells ethyl alcohol, sanitary napkins, lotions & deodorants. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy stock like alcohol, sanitary napkins & lotions.

Elsa has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock like alcohol, sanitary napkins & lotions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials to remodel a room in his parents' house.

loans.name: Imara Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Imara SHG Group in Western Kenya! Alice is the facilitator of the Imara SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alice takes care of 10 children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 23 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children and ensure that her family can afford day-to-day necessities.

In 2012, the members of Imara SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture: Alice is pictured in the photograph with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, nuevamente está solicitando préstamo, en este ocasión para la compra de abono y herbicidas para el cultivo de maíz, ella se decidió por este nuevo préstamo por la respuesta rápida, la buena atención. 
El préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho y su condición actual ha cambiado en la tienda, ya que compro mercaderia para ofrecer a los clientes, gracias a las inversiones que realiza y el buen manejo del préstamo esta logrando mejorar.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting another loan, on this occasion to buy fertilizer and herbicides to grow corn. She decided on this new loan thanks to the rapid response and the good service. 
 
The previous loan helped her very much, and her current condition has changed in her store, since she bought merchandise to offer to her customers. Thanks to the investments she has carried out and her good management of the loan funds, she is succeeding in improving her situation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for her corn crop.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina de 50 años vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia muy cerca al mar, su grupo familiar lo conforman su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 30 a 35 años. Guillermina trabajó en una importante empresa portuaria de Colombia y ella y su esposo son pensionados. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada y productos varios,  mediante guías especializadas, ella entrega la mercancía requerida por su cliente y este paga a su vez en dos partes, una contra entrega y la otra uno o dos meses después,  de acuerdo a lo negociado con su cliente. Guillermina es una mujer feliz, tiene una vivienda ubicada a 100 metros de la playa, donde se observa un hermoso paisaje que alegra a quien la visita. Sus hijos ya profesionales, uno de ellos viven  fuera del país, pero está siempre en contacto afectivo con su familia de origen. En la actualidad está solicitando un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará productos cosméticos, calzado, bolsos y perfumes que exhibió en su catálogo y tiene encargados, especialmente quiere surtirse muy bien,  para responder a la venta monumental del fin de año.
texts.en:
Guillermina, 50, lives in the town of Puerto Colombia very near the ocean.  Her family group consists of her husband and three children whose ages range from 30 to 35 years.  Guillermina worked for an important Colombian port firm and she and her husband are now retired.  For the last twenty years she’s been selling varied merchandise and assorted products via specialized catalogues.  She delivers the required goods to her customers who pay her in two installments, one upon delivery and the other one or two months later according to what’s been negotiated with each customer.

Guillermina is a happy woman.  She has a house situated 100 meters from the beach where she can enjoy a beautiful vista that gladdens everyone who visits.  Her children are now professionals; one of them lives abroad but is always in loving contact with his family of origin.

She is currently asking for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy cosmetics, footwear, purses and perfume that was featured in her catalogue and she has pending orders for.  She especially wants to be well-stocked to respond to the monumental end of year sales.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, footwear, purses and perfume.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Jerry is buying and peddling educational & spiritual magazines & books. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stock of magazines & books to sell.

Jerry has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jerry hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stock of magazines & books to sell.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Teresa tiene ya más de diez años con su negocio de venta de ropa usada y nueva en diferentes partes de la ciudad. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en compra de mas mercancía ya que le esta haciendo falta ropa de invierno, zapatos y quiere empezar a vender aparatos eléctricos. 
Con esta inversión su negocio tendrá más mercancía e ingreso a su negocio y familia.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene ya que su esposo el señor Marco Antonio se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus dos hijos  que están estudiando la secundaria.
texts.en: María Teresa has been selling new and used clothes in various parts of the city for over ten years now.  She’s asking for a loan to buy more merchandise since she needs winter clothes and shoes; she also wants to start to sell electric appliances.  With this investment the business will have more merchandise and income for the business and her family.  She plans to repay the loan with profits obtained since her husband, Marco Antonio, will take care of family expenses and school costs for their two children who are going to secondary school.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Jasho Shg Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Jasho SHG Group in Western Kenya! Jackline is the facilitator of the Jasho SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jackline takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits, to send her children to school, and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jackline had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jackline was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jackline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Jackline will educate her children and use the same to repay her loan.

In 2012, the members of Jasho SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Jackline is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mwangaza Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mwangaza SHG Group in Western Kenya! Pamela is the facilitator of the Mwangaza SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Everlyne takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed her family and have additional maize profits to educate her children. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had a very good maize yield, harvesting 7 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Everlyne will educate her children and invest in poultry rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mwangaza SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Everlyne is pictured with her group members in the photograph with their Field Officer on the far left in the blue shirt.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Walter Arcenio

texts.es:
Walter, es empleado, es soltero, vive con su familia, todos trabajan, él desde hace tres años trabaja como visitador médico, su horario es de 8:00am a 4:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para reparar su vehículo en el cual trabaja, ya que presenta algunos problemas y debe enviarlo al mecánico, el préstamo le ayudara para tener en buenas condiciones su vehículo, ya que le permite trasladarse hacia su trabajo y viceversa. 
Su aspiración es tener un buen desarrollo en su trabajo, colaborar con su familia.
texts.en:
Walter is an employee.  He is single and lives with his family.  They all work.  Walter has been working as a medical sales rep for three years.  He works from 8.00am to 4.00pm.

Walter is requesting this loan to have his work vehicle repaired as it has some problems and he needs to send it to the mechanic.  This loan will help him to have his vehicle in good condition so that he can travel to and from his work.

Walter's aspiration is to make good progress in his job and to cooperate with his family.

loans.use: to pay a mechanic and buy spare parts

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Cindy is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Cindy has a shop that sells fish like sardines & salmon. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fish to sell.

Cindy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cindy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Isabel Catalina

texts.es: La socia Isabel está solicitando otro préstamo para incrementar el capital del negocio de venta de ropa, ella desea comprar ropa como por ejemplo pantalones, zapatos, blusas y otras cosas más pues se está acercando la epoca de campaña navideña. El anterior crédito a la socia Isabel le ayudo en el pequeño negocio y obtuvo buenas ganancias de la cuales lo invirtió en el gasto familiar. La socia Isabel está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en: Isabel is asking for another loan to increase the capital in her clothing business.  She wants to buy clothes like pants, shoes, blouses and other things because the Christmas season is approaching.  The previous loan helped Isabel’s small business and she earned good profits that she invested in family expenses.  Isabel is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as pants, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting, wood, nails, and some cooking utensils.

loans.name: Canaani Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Canaani Group in Western Kenya! Violet is the facilitator of the Canaani group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Violet is a mother of five children. She joined One Acre Fund due to the best prices offered by the firm and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Violet had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 15 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Violet was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Violet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Violet will educate her children and use the same in loan repayment.

In 2012, the members of Canaani group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Violet is pictured in the photograph with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Cheryl has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy fish to sell.

Cheryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cheryl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Naumo Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Naumo Group in Western Kenya! Rose is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose takes care of 11 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Rose will educate her children and invest in livestock.

In 2012, the members of Naumo Group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Claudia Arely

texts.es:
Claudia, es empleada de una joyería, vive con su hija, es madre soltera, tiene dos años de trabajar en dicha joyería, es una persona honesta y muy trabajadora, además que tiene la responsabilidad familiar con su hija, para quien tiene que proveer todo lo necesario.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de utensilios para el hogar, plancha, licuadoras, y pagar un saldo pendiente en otra institución, este préstamo le ayudara para tener lo necesario en su hogar y solventar cuentas pendientes.
El objetivo de Claudia es continuar en su empleo, generar ingresos para el hogar y velar por las necesidades de su hija.
texts.en: Claudia is an employee of a jewelry store.  She lives with her daughter and is a single mother.  She has worked in said jewelry store for two years.  She is a very hard-working and honest person, besides the fact that she has the family responsibility for her daughter, for whom she has to provide all that is needed.  At present she requests a loan for the purchase of utensils for the home such as an iron and blender, and to pay a pending balance in another institution, this loan helps her to have the necessary things in her home and to settle outstanding accounts.  Claudia's objective is to continue in her employment, to generate income for the home and to provide for the needs of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy utentils for the home such as an iron and blender and to pay a pending balance

loans.name: Bidii F.f.s Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii F.F.S SHG Group in Western Kenya! Jackson is the facilitator of the Bidii F.F.S SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jackson  takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Jackson had an excellent maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Jackson was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jackson  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Jackson will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in goats and sheep.

In 2012, the members of Bidii F.F.S SHG Group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photo, Jackson is pictured with his group and at the far left is the One Acre Fund field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: April Veneth

texts.en:
April Veneth is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

April Veneth has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000  to buy fish to sell.

April Veneth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, April Veneth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Lucy Zoraida

texts.es:
La señora Lucy requiere otro préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio de venta de cosméticos, ella vende por ejemplo cremas, perfumes, colonias y otros productos más.  A Lucy el anterior crédito le ayudo en el pequeño negocio y obtuvo buenas ganancias de las cuales lo invirtió en el gasto familiar. La socia Lucy está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.

La señora Lucy está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Lucy needs another loan to continue investing in her cosmetics business.  She sells creams, perfume, cologne and other products.  The previous loan helped Lucy’s small business and she earned good profits that she used to cover family expenses.  Lucy is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products to have a wider selection available for her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials needed for making dresses & curtains.

loans.name: Yady

texts.es: Yady realiza dos actividades, ella es comerciante de carnes frías y manicurista, la primera actividad le genera más ingresos y aunque la inició después de ser manicurista, aprovechó esta actividad para construir su hoy clientela de productos cárnicos y de mercancía variada.  Cuando Yadi empezó su idea emprendedora, lo hizo capacitándose como manicurista hace 10 años, luego ganó experiencia trabajando como empleada en un salón de belleza durante 2 años  y posteriormente se independizó, logrando utilidades que invirtió en mercancías y posteriormente incursionó en la venta de carnes frías cuando había construido un mercado propio. Yady con sus negocios apoya los gastos familiares de su hogar conformado por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos de 5 a 11 años. La labor de manicurista la realiza principalmente a domicilio. Sus ventas mensuales le generan un buen margen de rentabilidad lo que le  permite aportar a los gastos del hogar y cubrir sus gastos personales, no posee activos fijos, sus activos son todos corrientes. Su margen de rentabilidad está acorde al tipo de negocio. En la actualidad se prepara para las fiestas de fin de año y requiere comprar carnes frías que tiene encargados, así como mercancías variadas como interiores, ropa femenina e insumos para el desempeño de su actividad como manicurista. Esta es la razón por la cual requiere un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, lo cual invertirá en los productos ya mencionados.
texts.en:
Yady carries out two activities: she’s a cold cuts merchant and a manicurist.  The first activity generates more income and although she started it after she became a manicurist she took advantage of the opportunity to build her clientele for meat products and assorted merchandise.  When she began with her entrepreneurial idea, she took courses ten years ago to become a manicurist.  She gained experience working as an employee in a beauty salon for two years and then became independent earning profits that she invested in merchandise which led to her going into the cold cuts business once she had an established clientele of her own.

Yady covers family expenses with her businesses.  Her family consists of her spouse and three children whose ages range from 5 to 11 years.  She provides the manicure services primarily in customers’ homes.  Her monthly sales produce a good profit margin which allows her to contribute to household expenses and convert her personal needs.  She does not own fixed assets; all of her assets are fluid.  Her profit margin is appropriate for this type of business.

She is currently getting ready for the end of year festivities and needs to buy cold cuts she has pending orders for as well as assorted merchandise like underwear, women’s wear and supplies she needs for her work as a manicurist.  This is why she needs a Kiva loan, the first financing she gets from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll invest in the products already mentioned above.

loans.use: to buy cold cuts she has on order as well as assorted merchandise like underwear, women's clothes and supplies.

loans.name: Water Project Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Water Project Group in Western Kenya! Simon is the facilitator of the Water Project group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Simon takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send  his children to school and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Simon had a very good maize yield, harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Simon was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Simon and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Simon will buy more land and educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Water Project group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Simon is pictured with his group members in the photograph as shown.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: La socia tiene 57 años de edad, la socia continua con sus negocios y ella sigue comprando animales vacunos; la socia en esta ocasión desea el credito para invertir en la comrpa de 2 toros, la socia dice que los toritos tiernos cuestan entre 450 a 600 soles cada uno, la socia desea comprar dos animales vacunos y la socia manifiesta que ella desde que tiene el credito en cada desembolso suele invertir en sus negocios, algunos meses lo ha estado invirtiendo en la compra de chanchos, cuyes, en su terreno de cultivo, en la compra d evacas, y en esta ocasión desea aumentar sus ganados vacunos, ella con todo lo que le genera sus diferentes actividades suele mejorar su vivienda con las mejoras de los acabados, el baño, y comprando terrenos de cultivo. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de 2 toritos tiernos.
texts.en: The member is 57 years old and continues with her businesses; she continues to buy cattle.  On this occasion she wants the loan to buy two bulls.  She says that young bullocks cost between 450 and 600 soles each.  She wants to buy two bulls and she says that since she’s had the loan she invests each disbursement in her business.  Some months she’s invested it in purchasing pigs or guinea pigs, in her fields and in the purchase of cows.  On this occasion she wants to increase her cattle herd.  With what all her various activities earn she tends to improve her house making improvements to the finishing, bathroom and also buying farmland.  She is asking for the loan to buy two young bullocks.

loans.use: to buy two young bullocks.

loans.name: Amuka Oaf Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Amuka OAF Group in Western Kenya! Arnold is the facilitator of the Amuka OAF SHG Group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Arnold takes care of one child at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and be able to build a house for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Arnold had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 7 bags on 0.5 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Arnold was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 0.5 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Arnold  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Arnold would like to build a new house for his family.

In 2012, the members of Amuka OAF SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ana Del Tránsito

texts.es: Ana del Tránsito, D. cuarenta y tres años D. edad, resiD. al Occidente del país en zona urbana y junto a ella viven su esposo Luis y dos menores hijas  D. 9 y 2 años D. edad, la primera ya estudia. Ana posee en su mismo lugar D. residencia desD. hace muchos años una venta D. materiales D. construcción que son: arena, grava y tierra para compactación D. suelos. Ana del Transito es una persona responsable, honrada y trabajadora, se encuentra muy bien referenciada. Don Luis, su esposo hace en su camión los traslados D. materiales D. las ventas realizadas y esto significa otro ingreso para el hogar D. Ana; el negocio D. Ana es lo único que da sostenimiento económico a ésta familia, y ahora Ana, dado que se acerca la época D. verano y a sabiendas D. que es cuando las personas más construyen desea comprar mayor cantidad D. materiales D. los que ya posee en su inventario a fin D. no perder oportunidad D. hacer negocios. Para ello espera contar con un crédito por parte D. INTEGRAL que le permita comprar lo que necesita y así mejorar la calidad D. vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Ana del Tránsito, age 43, lives in a rural area in the western part of the country.  She lives with her husband, Luis, and two minor children, ages 9 and 2.  The oldest goes to school.

For several years Ana has had a business at her house.  She sells construction materials; sand, gravel, and soil for compacting floors.  Ana del Transito is a responsible, honorable, and hard-working woman.  She has very good references.  Luis, her husband, uses his truck to transport the materials that have been sold.  This means another income for Ana’s household.

Ana’s business is the only one that gives her family financial stability.  Given that the summer season is approaching, and knowing that this is when people build the most, Ana wishes to buy a greater quantity of materials.  She wants more than what she has in her inventory in order to not lose business opportunities.

In order to do so she hopes to count on a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow her to buy what she needs.  That way her family’s quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy  sand, gravel, and soil for compacting floors.

loans.name: Nyange Huruma Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Nyange Huruma Group in Western Kenya! Consolata is the facilitator of the Nyange Huruma group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Consolata takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Consolata had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Consolata was only able to harvest 1 bag of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Consolata and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Consolata will educate her children and invest in business.

In 2012, the members of the Nyange Huruma group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Consolata is pictured with her group members in the photograph, with their Field Officer (Annah Malemo) on the left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yessica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yessica, administra una tienda donde ofrecen productos de primera necesidad, vive con su esposo y un hijo, este negocio lo tiene en el centro de la ciudad y aprovecha a vender más que todos los días de comercio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo  para la compra de frijol, arroz, aceite, pastas, papel higiénico, esta compra es muy necesaria para que el negocio este fortalecido y pueda atender la demanda.
La aspiración de Yessica es que con estos préstamos pueda crecer en calidad de comerciante, recibiendo más clientela y generando mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Yessica administers a store where she offers groceries and necessities.  She lives with her husband and son.  She has her business in the center of the city and she takes advantage of the location to sell more than others.  At present she requests a loan for the purchase of beans, rice, oil, pastas, nd toilet paper.  This purchase is very necessary so that the business is well supplied and she can attend to the demand.  Yessica's aspiration is that she grow merchant with this loan, receiving more clientele and generating greater profits.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, oil, pasta and toilet paper.

loans.name: Mapera B Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Mapera B Group in Western Kenya! George is the facilitator of the Mapera B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

George is a father of five children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to ensure food security to his family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, George had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, George was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to George and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, George will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mapera B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
George is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 10 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara platos como estofado de pollo, lomo saltado y sopas, la socia trabaja en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne, pollo y verduras. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY” community bank. It is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member's name is Hilda; she is 44 years old, married, and has ten children. She divides her time between her daily responsibilities at home and her small business. Hilda prepares dishes such as stewed chicken, Peruvian stir fry, and soup, and sells them from a street cart from 9:00 a.m. to 7 p.m. The income she generates from her business helps her support her children. Hilda wants to expand and improve her food preparation services. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients, such as rice, meat, poultry and vegetables.

Hilda is happy to have access to this loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, meat, poultry and vegetables.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Upendo Group in Western Kenya! It's headed by Mary as the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mary is a mother of seven children. She joined One Acre Fund due to the best farm produce achieved as a result of use of fertilizer and hybrid seeds provided by the firm and to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had a very good maize yield, harvesting 11 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Mary will educate her children and use the same for loan repayment.

In 2012, the members of Upendo group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Mary is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, estos estudian y por las tardes ayudan a su padre, don Mariano empezó desde muy joven a trabajar la agricultura, ya que también su padre lo realizaba y le enseño todo el proceso.
Actualmente necesita comprar fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para tameguar, por lo que solicita un préstamo que le ayude a solventar esta situación y que sus cultivos se den de la mejor manera.
Él tiene por objetivo apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios, de esta manera apoyarlos para la superación de ellos y que tengan un futuro con mejores oportunidades.
texts.en: Mariano is a farmer.  He lives with his wife and three children, who are students and help their father in the afternoons.  Mariano began working in agrigulture when he was very young, since his father was also a farmer and taught him all the processes.  At present he needs to buy fertilizer and to pay labor to weed, for which he requests a loan that will help him to settle this situation and to improve his crop yield.  He considers it his objective to support his children in their studies, and in this manner to support their development so that they will have a future with better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay labor to weed.

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Umoja Group in Western Kenya! Getrude is the facilitator of the Umoja group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Getrude takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to best prices offered by the firm and in order to access fertilizer. In the recent 2011 season, Getrude had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 24 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Pamela was only able to harvest 7 1/2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Getrude and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Getrude will invest in business and livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Umoja group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Getrude is pictured in the photograph together with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yolanda Antonia

texts.es: Yolanda Antonia, de cincuenta y dos años de edad, reside al Occidente del país en una colonia que se encuentra en zona urbana, son más de seis años los de vivir ahí, junto a ella vive un hijo mayor de edad y la esposa de él, Yolanda les ha dado apoyo para que inicien su vida como pareja. Yolanda cuenta principalmente con la ayuda económica que brinda su hija que se halla en el extranjero, gracias a esos aportes, inteligentemente Yolanda estableció desde hace más de un año en su misma casa, una tienda donde provee productos de primera necesidad a vecinos y personas que transitan, aprovechando que se encuentra ubicada sobre calle principal de la colonia que ha resultado ser un sitio muy estratégico y excelente para vender, así lo cuenta Yolanda. Ella es muy atenta, ordenada y  Alegre, y es lo que probablemente ha marcado la diferencia frente a los demás negocios cercanos y para que la prefieran sus clientes;  en el poco tiempo que tiene de funcionar el negocio se ha vuelto uno de los mas surtidos de la zona. En atención a contar con productos que demandan más sus clientes o no posee actualmente es que Yolanda se encuentra solicitando financiamiento a INTEGRAL y poder comprar sardinas enlatadas, cereal para bebé, agua y jugos embotellados, pañales desechables, medicinas, jabones y detergentes.  Espera con las ganancias que obtenga ir haciendo un fondo de ahorro que le sirva para cuando ya no pueda trabajar
texts.en:
Yolanda Antonia, age 52, lives in an urban zone in the western region of the country. She has lived there for more than six years, along with her son and his wife. She is helping to support the young couple as they begin married life. Yolanda is financially dependent on her daughter, who lives abroad. 

More than a year ago, Yolanda wisely decided to open a small store in her home. She sells basic necessities to her neighbors and people passing through the neighborhood, taking advantage of her location on the main street through town. She is very attentive, organized and happy, which makes her business stand out from the other stores nearby. In the short time she has been running her business, Yolanda's store has already become known as one of the best-stocked stores in the area.
 
In order to maintain stock of products in high demand and to fulfill requests by her customers, Yolanda is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL. She plans to buy tins of sardines, baby food, bottled water and juice, disposable diapers, medicine, soap and detergent. With the income from her business, Yolanda hopes to continue saving so she can support herself after she is no longer able to work.

loans.use: To buy tins of sardines, baby food, bottled water and juice, disposable diapers, medicine, soap and detergent.

loans.name: Roxana Yenny

texts.es: La socia ha mejorardo las ventas en su negocio y desea en esta ocasión invertir el credito para comprar materiales y continuar creciendo, la socia dice que la confeccion de las muñecas de trapo han dado muy buenos frutos y en esta ocasion ella esta incrementando su negocio comprando materiales partala confeccion de las muñecas de trapo y también esta entrando en la compra de artesanía popular para la venta a lso turistas que visitan esta bella zona llamada la capilla sixtina de américa es un pueblo muy pintorezco y sumamente tranquilo y la socia ha podido dar mejor calidad d evida  asus hijos y ella esta invirtiendo sus ingresos en la compra de terrenos para la siembra de maíz y la venta del mimso. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiale spara la fabricacion de muñecas de trapo con telares y mantas.
texts.en:
The member has improved sales in her business and on this occasion wants to use the loan to buy supplies to continue growing.  She says that making rag dolls has produced good results and she now wants to increase business buying supplies to make rag dolls but she’s also going into buying popular crafts to sell to tourists who visit this beautiful zone called The Sistine Chapel of America.  It is a very picturesque, extremely peaceful town.  
She has managed to provide her children with an improved quality of life and she is using her income to buy farmland to grow corn to sell.  She is asking for the loan to buy supplies to make rag dolls with fabric and looms.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make rag dolls.

With income from maize sales, Elizabeth will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ng'ona Engo group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Elizabeth is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yeni; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, galletas entre otros productos, por medio de este negocio al socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos  como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos al por mayor para implementar la tienda de abarrotes. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yeni, 22, is a member of the “Señor de los Temblores-Poroy” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She is single and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with a grocery store.  She sells staples like rice, sugar, milk and cookies, among other products.  Through this business she’s able to support her children.  She wants to expand and improve the grocery selling business and is asking for a loan to buy products like rice, sugar, milk and noodles at wholesale to stock the grocery store.  She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Malaa B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Malaa B Group in Western Kenya! Joshua is the facilitator of the Malaa B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.  

Joshua takes care of seven children at home, together with his wife.  He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Joshua had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 23 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joshua was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joshua and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Joshua will educate his children and repay his loan with the same.

In 2012, the members of Malaa B Group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Joshua is pictured in the photograph together with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay laborers

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

Through this business she’s able to support her children.  She wants to expand and improve the grocery store and is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles at wholesale.  She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.
