With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Margret and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Margret will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Agape B Women group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Margret is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Señora Julia pertenece al banco comunal “Chaska Ñahui” y las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en el distrito de Wanchaq perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

Señora Julia nació en la ciudad de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades, ella trabaja en una empresa que se dedica a la venta de lácteos. Ya son dos años que se trabaja en esa empresa y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Señora Julia solicita el préstamo para la hacer mantenimiento de la casa. Señora Julia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the “Chaska Ñahui” communal bank.  The bank’s meetings take place monthly in Wanchaq District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  

Julia was born in Cusco and still lives there and carries out her activities there.  She works for a firm that sells dairy products.  She’s worked there for two years already and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She is asking for a loan to do some home improvements.  Julia is happy with the loan and pledges to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: María Vicenta

texts.es: María Vicenta, D. cincuenta y tres años D. edad resiD. al Oriente del país en zona semiurbana desD. hace muchos años, su grupo familiar está integrado por tres hijos mayores D. edad: José, Ever y Evelin; y su esposo.  Vicenta posee en su misma casa una tienda donD. suministra productos D. primera necesidad y además un molino donD. presta el servicio D. moler maíz, tomate, yuca, arroz, café, entre otros, éste último negocio es atendido por su esposo; en esta familia todos colaboran al sostenimiento o lo impulsan ya que sus hijos trabajan cultivando la tierra, son jornaleros y la hija se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. María Vicenta es una mujer con un potencial envidiable, organizada, siempre se esmera porque en su negocio D. la tienda no falte nada, en éstos últimos días sus clientes han estado demandando mayor cantidad D. harinas, leches, pan dulce, granos básicos y ella cuenta en poca cantidad los mismos, por lo que desea incrementar su inventario a fin D. hacer mejores negocios,  así como comprar algunos repuestos para el molino, espera que con la ayuda D. INTEGRAL ello sea posible, y ésto abone a la busqueda D. una mejor calidad D. vida D. su familia
texts.en:
María Vicenta, 53, has lived in the east of the country in a semirural zone for many years.  Her family group is composed of three adult children: José, Ever and Evelin and her husband.  Vicenta has a home-based store where she stocks basic need items and also has a mill where she provides services grinding corn, tomato, manioc, rice and coffee, among others.  This latter business is run by her husband.  In this family everyone contributes to family support since her sons work the fields, they are day laborers, and her daughter does the household chores.

María Vicenta is a woman with an enviable potential; she’s organized and always strives to insure that her store does not lack anything.  These last few days her customers have been asking for larger amounts of flour, milk, sweet bread and basic grains and her stock is low.  She’d like to increase her inventory to earn better profits and also needs to buy some spare parts for the mill.  She hopes that with help from INTEGRAL this will be possible and will contribute to her search for a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store and replacement parts for the mill.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María comerciante sus planes a corto plazo es mejora su vivienda. Con el préstamo anterior alcanzo mayor clientela y a su vez variedad de productos para vender que beneficio a su familia ya que recibió utilidades para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio y realizo un anexo en el porche de su casa para expandir la pulpería. Con este ciclo de préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, laminas de zinc ondulado, pelines, barría de soldar, coloso, platinas entre otros materiales para cambiar el techo de la casa que es de madera y las tiene en mal estado cambiándolos por perlines y nuevas laminas de zinc. Agradece a ala financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y al mejoramiento de su nivel de vida ya que obtendrá comodidad y seguridad.
texts.en:
María is a saleswoman whose short term plan is to improve her home.  She used her previous loan to reach more customers and increase the variety of products she sells.  This benefited her family as she made profits which she used to continue investing in her business and also added an extension to her house porch so that she could expand her grocery store.

María will use this loan to buy building materials such as cement, sand, sheets of corrugated metal, beams, a soldering iron, bolts, metal edging etc. so that she can replace the roof of her house which is currently made of wood and in a bad state of repair.  She will replace it with roofing beams and new sheets of metal.  She is grateful to the financial institution for this support in making progress in her business and improving her standard of living as it will provide her with comfort and security.

loans.use: to invest in buying building materials

loans.name: Musemwa S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Musemwa S.H Group in Western Kenya! Kennedy is the facilitator of the Musemwa S.H group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Kennedy takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Kennedy had a very good maize yield, harvesting 21 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Kennedy was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Kennedy  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Kennedy will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Musemwa S.H group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: La socia tiene actualmente 41 años de edad; la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de animales menores y ella ha visto el incremento en sus ganancias principalmente con la venta de cuyes, la socia vende a los diferentes restaurantes de la zona turistica y también le contratan para otros eventos, como agazajos en matrimonios, cumpleñaos, bautizos, cargos, y ella abastece a los clientes con la venta de animales menores; la socia ha mejorado la calidad de vida de sus hijos y a invertido las ganancias en arreglos del hogar, ella también desea seguir creciendo y comprar terrenos de cultivo, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el nuevo crédito en la compra de 50 cuyes, los cuales criara y vendera segun la madurez de los mismos, la socia también desea comprar un par de chanchos tiernos para la venta. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de chanchos y de 50 cuyes.
texts.en:
Luisa is currently 41 years old.  She tells us that she has a total of 7 children.  She is engaged in the purchase and sale of small animals and has seen an increase in her earnings, primarily from the sale of guinea pigs.  Luisa sells to different restaurants in the tourist area, and they also purchase from her for special events.

She has improved the quality of life for her children and also has invested earnings in home repairs.  She also wants to continue increasing her earnings and purchase agricultural land.

Luisa wishes to invest the new loan in the purchase of 50 guinea pigs which she is going to raise and sell at maturity.  She also wants to purchase a pair of newborn pigs for sale.  She is applying for the loan in order to invest in the purchase of piglets and 50 guinea pigs.

loans.use: to purchase small animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de vender canastas, la socia teje canastas y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que hay en la ciudad de Cusco, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de canastas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer las canastas como yute, hilos y tejedores al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner is a member of the "SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY" ("Lord of the Earthquakes-Poroy") community bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

The partner is Juana, 34, who lives with her partner and has 6 children. Alongside her daily activities she has a basket selling business. She weaves baskets and sells them in the different markets in the city of Cusco. She works from 8am to 7pm. The business allows her to support her children. She would like to expand her basket selling business. That's why she's requesting a loan to buy materials to make baskets with, such as jute, yarn and weaves, wholesale.

The partner is grateful for the loan and is committed to repaying it as agreed.

loans.use: to buy materials to make baskets with, such as jute, yarn and weaves, wholesale.

loans.name: Bai

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Bai. He is married and has four children, age 6, 9 (twins) and 12 years. They are all school-going children. 

In 2001, Bai established his shoes and clothing business. He began his business because he did not have the opportunity for someone to support him through school and needed a source of income to provide a livelihood for his family. When he dropped out of school, he joined his elder brother in business until he had his own small business that he was peddling.  From there he now can boast of this shop.  

Competition is high but he normally beats his competitors by offering the latest designs. This meets the demands of the customers. He serves customers around town and the outskirts of the city. His business is popular because of the latest fashions and the good quality and prices of his goods. He is assisted by his wife, and he usually travels to Guinea two times in the month by public transportation to buy his business stocks.

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business.  

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Bai requires a loan in order to purchase 60 pairs of ladies' jeans @ 35,000 SLL and six pairs of Timberland boots @ 150,000 SLL. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

In the future, Bai plans to build a house and open another outlet for his business. He wants to support his children through their education.  

Rainy season is usually his biggest challenge as sales are slow.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase jeans and boots to resell.

loans.name: Vumilia S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Vumilia S.H Group in Western Kenya! Jackline is the facilitator of the Vumilia S.H. group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jackline  takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jackline had a very good maize yield, harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Jackline was only able to harvest 4.5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jackline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Jackline will educate her children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Vumilia S.H. Group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche,fideos y detergentes, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia quiere terminar de construir su casa y también quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como yeso y arena para terminar de hacer el piso de su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alicia belongs to the SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, a part of the province and department of Cusco.

Alicia is 32 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery shop business. She sells staples such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and detergents. Alicia works from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. Working this way she hopes to enlarge her grocery shop.

Alicia wants to finish the construction of her house and also enlarge her shop. She is applying for the loan in order to purchase construction materials such as plaster and sand in order to finish building another floor on her house. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as plaster and sand in order to finish building another floor on her house.

loans.name: M.m.h.u Group

texts.en:
Greetings from M.M.H.U Group in Western Kenya! Rose is the facilitator of the M.M.H.U SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rose will buy more livestock assets. 

In 2012, the members of M.M.H.U SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Luz Aurora

texts.es: La señora Luz Aurora sigue con el consultorio médico y le va muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de los equipos médicos. La señora Luz Aurora es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras siguen confiando en ella. La señora Luz Aurora está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Luz Aurora continues with her medical office and is doing very well.  On this occasion she needs the loan to provide maintenance for the medical equipment.  Luz Aurora is a responsible, hardworking person and her fellow group members continue trusting her because of these qualities.  Luz Aurora is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to provide maintenance for her medical equipment.

loans.name: Antonio Edalberto

texts.es:
Antonio Edalberto tiene 48 años de edad es casado tiene tres hijos, vive  con la esposa y con los tres hijos de veinte, catorce y dos años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul.
Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza Echeandia. 

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos.Con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ha ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. 

Este nuevo Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá  comprar semilas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos y podrá sembrar maíz, arroz y cosechar para tener utilidades.
El sueño es poderse comprar un carro.En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar futbol y salir con la familia a pasear.
"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Antonio Edalberto, 48, is married and has three children.  He lives with his wife and three children who are 20, 14 and 2 years of age in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “Nueva Unión” communal bank is located in Recinto Guamayacu belonging to Echeandía Canton.  This communal bank’s members are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

He used the previous loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to keep his crops in good condition.

Relations in his family have improved because now he’s able to contribute a bit more toward family wellbeing.  At work he’s doing much better because production has increased and income has risen quite a bit because he earns more income when he sells his products.  
Support from the previous loan has helped him improve himself and he didn’t have any problem making his installment payments as established by the communal bank.

This new loan will be of much help because he’ll be able to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer and manure and will be able to plant corn and rice and to harvest to earn profits.

His dream is to be able to buy a car.  During his free time he likes playing soccer and going out on family excursions.  He is very grateful for the help provided.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 25 años, convive con Dagoberto de 24 años, que fruto de esta relación tienen un hijo. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la urbanización Sivia. Adela, consecuente y luchadora con sus objetivos, cuenta que años atrás la situación económica de esta parte del país estuvo estancado por la inestabilidad social y económica. Por tal razón no logró concluir sus estudios al quedarse huérfana de Papá y Mamá; y con 5 hermanos pequeños que tuvo que cuidar. La chacra que tenían no era suficiente para mantenerse ya que los frutos, no tenían mucha rentabilidad, es por ello que decidió trabajar como empleada del hogar, donde conoció a Dagoberto que ahora es su querido esposo. Tiempos después Adela con el poco ahorro que tenía más el de su esposo decidieron abrir un bar, donde ahora expenden licores, y toda clase de bebidas. Para ella los mejores días de venta son los fines de semana y feriados, dicho bar cuenta con un amplio lugar de esparcimiento. Esta feliz con este negocio ya que le genera un buen ingreso económico. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el que ella esta comprometida en cancelar puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas. Además está contenta con los de su banco comunal, porque son puntuales con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 soles que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más licores para abastecer su bar.
texts.en:
Adela, 25, lives with Dagoberto, 24, and their son. They live in their own house located in the Silvia neighbourhood. 

Adela, who is consistent and fights for her goals, explains that a few years ago the financial situation in this part of the country suffered from stagnation due to social and economic instability. Because of this and the death of her mother and father she was unable to finish her schooling; she had 5 younger siblings to look after. The farm they had was not enough to support them as it wasn't very profitable. That's why she decided to work as maid, where she met Dagoberto, her beloved husband. 

Some time later, Adela and her husband used their small savings to open a bar, where they sell liquor and all kinds of drinks. For her the best days for the business are week-ends and holidays. The bar has plenty of room for recreation. She is happy with the business as it generates a good income. 

This is her first loan with MFP. She is committed to repaying it on time. She is also very pleased with her community bank, because everyone repays the loans on time. She will invest the 1,500 soles requested in the purchase of liquor to stock up her bar.

loans.use: to buy liquor for her bar.

loans.name: Rosenda Maria

texts.es:
Rosenda, vive con sus dos hijos, es administradora y propietaria de un comedor donde le ofrece a los clientes comida como desayunos, almuerzos y antojitos, dicho negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, lo atiende todos los días a tiempo completo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad en su negocio como carnes, verduras, pollo,aceite, sal esta compra le ayudar a mejorar y surtir su negocio.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar su negocio para tener mayores ingresos económicos y darle la educación adecuada a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosenda lives with her two children. She is the administrator and owner of a café where she offers her customers food such as breakfasts, lunches, and snacks. She says that the business emerged as a result of her own initiatives. She works at it every day full time.

She is applying for a loan in order to purchase basic goods need for her business such as meats, vegetables, chicken, oil and salt. These purchases will help her improve and stock her business. Her biggest dream is to improve her business in order to have greater income and give an adequate education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase meats, vegetables, chicken, oil, and salt.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, chompas, polos y blusas, la socia vende ropa para varones, mujeres y niños, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, polos y blusas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY” Community Bank located in the district of Cuzco, province and city of Cuzco.  Her name is Juana.  She is 53 years old, single, and has six children.  She alternates her daily activities with a business selling clothing.  She sells pants, sweaters, t-shirts, and blouses.  She sells men's, women's, and children's clothing.  She sells the clothing on the streets and this business has allowed her help her children get ahead.  She wants to expand and improve her business selling clothing.  She is asking for a loan to buy clothing, such as pants, t-shirts, and blouses in bulk.  She is happy for the loan and committed to repaying it.

loans.use: buy clothing, like pants, shirts, and blouses in bulk.

loans.name: Nondekho Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nondekho Group in Western Kenya! Tobista is the facilitator of the Nondekho SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Tobista takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Tobista had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Tobista was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Tobista and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Tobista will pay for school fees and major household expenses.

In 2012, the members of Nondekho SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photo, Tobista is pictured with her group and at the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Actualmente la socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia esta en espera de su 5to hijo, ella se encuentra embarazada y feliz por la llegada de su hijo ; la socia ha cambiado totalmente de negocio, ella en la actualidad se encuentra con sus nuevo y propio negocio, la socia se concidera comerciante minorista, la socia compra y vende animale menores, ella compra cuyes, chanchos, aves de corral y los vende ella comenta que cuando compra una gallina a 10 soles ella lo cría engorda y luego viva la vende a 25 soles, entonces ahí esta la ganancia de hacer madurar a las gallinas y es casi igual con los otros animales menores es más rentable los cuyes porque se procrean rápido y aumenta el numero de ellos para la venta. La socia ahora depende solo de su esfuerzo y trabaja arduamente para mejorar sus ganancias y sacar adelnate junto a su conyugue a sus menores hijos y mejorar su vivienda. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores.
texts.en: This group member is 35 years old.  She is currently awaiting the birth of her fifth child. She is pregnant and happy about the arrival of her baby.  She has completely changed her business and now works with a new business.  She works buying and selling small animals, like guinea pigs, pigs, and poultry.  She shared that when she buys a hen for 10 soles she can fatten it and later sell it for 25 soles.  That is how the profits work with hens, and it is almost the same with the other animals, although guinea pigs are more profitable because they procreate quickly and then she has more to sell.  She is dependent on her own labor and works very hard to increase her earnings and, together with her husband, help her young children and improve their home.  She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of young animals.

loans.use: buy young animals to raise

loans.name: Santa Isabel

texts.es:
Santa Isabel tiene 43 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el  esposo y con los hijos de veintitrés y diesiete años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul.

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos. Con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ha ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. 

Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque ayudará a ampliar el negocio. 
"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Santa Isabel is 43 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children, who are 23 and 17. They live in the Ventanas settlement of the Los Ríos province.

The NUEVA UNIÓN (New Union) Community Bank is located in Guamayacu, in the settlement of Echeandía. In this area, people work farming fast-growing crops like corn, rice, beans, and peas.

With her previous loan, she was able to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to help maintain the good condition of her crops.

Her family relationships have improved because she now can help provide more for the family. Her work is going much better for her because she has increased production and earnings. The previous loan helped her to get ahead and she had no trouble repaying the loan on time.

She is asking for this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to keep her crops in good condition. The loan will be a big help because it will help her expand her business. She is very thankful for the help that is being provided.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to help maintain her crops

loans.name: Darajani Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Darajani Farmers Group in Western Kenya! Susy is the facilitator of the Darajani Farmers SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Susy takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Susy had an excellent maize yield harvesting 13 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Susy was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Susy and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Susy will educate her children and ensure that the family has enough food throughout the year.

In 2012, the members of Darajani Farmers SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photo, Susy is pictured with her group members and at the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Erika; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el restaurant y también quiere terminar de hacer el acabado de su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como arena y cemento.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Señor de los Temblores-Poroy Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco, province and department of Cusco.  
Erika is 25 years old.  She lives with her partner and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and the management of her restaurant.  She prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner and works from 8:00 AM until 9:00 PM.  This business provides the means for her children to get ahead in life.  Erika wishes to expand the restaurant and also finish the work on her house.  She is requesting this loan to buy construction materials such as sand and cement. She is happy to be receiving the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as sand and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos y autopartes de carros, la socia también trabaja como contadora, por medio de este negocio y este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de autopartes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar autopartes y repuestos para carros al por mayor.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Señor de los Temblores-Poroy Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cuzco, which belongs to the province and department of Cuzco.

This member is 32 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with a business selling auto parts, and she also works as an accountant.  Through this business and her work this member is able to get her children ahead.  She wants to expand and improve the auto parts business.  She is asking for this loan to buy auto parts in bulk.

This member is very happy thanks to the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy auto parts in bulk

loans.name: Khasinja Joint Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Khasinja Joint Group in Western Kenya! Gaudancia is the facilitator of the Khasinja Joint SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Gaudancia takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Gaudancia had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Gaudancia was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Gaudancia and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Gaudancia will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Khasinja Joint SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photo, Gaudancia is pictured with her group members and at the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Mirian Guicela

texts.es:
Mirian Guicela tiene treinta años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con la mamá y los hijos en el Cantón Ventana Provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul.

Mirian se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza Echeandia. 

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción, los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos. Con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ha ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. 

Este nuevo Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque lo solicita para comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos,El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque le ayudará a ampliar el negocio y poder tener mejores utilidades.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es seguir trabajando para poder adquirir otro préstamo pero ya el monto más alto para comprar algunas hectáreas de terreno para poder sembrar cacao.
En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música, hacer reuniones entre los moradores para realizar programas en la comunidad.
"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Mirian Guicela is 30 years old, single, and has two children.  She lives with her mother and children in Ventana Canton of Los Ríos Province.

The Nueva Unión Communal Bank is located in the Guamayacu area of Echeandía Canton.  This bank deals with agricultural work, specifically the short-cycle planting of corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Mirian works in farming, planting corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  She does her buying and selling in Echeandía.

With the money from her previous loan, she was able to buy farming supplies such as urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killer to keep her crops in good condition.

Her relationship with her family has improved because now she is able to contribute more to the family's well-being.  Her work is going much better because her productivity has increased.  Her income has improved a lot because she now receives more from selling her produce.  The help of her previous loan helped her better herself and she had no problem making the payments set out by the cooperative.

This new loan will be very helpful because she is asking for it to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killer to keep her crops in good condition.  The loan will be very helpful because it will help her grow her business and be able to make more profits.

The challenges she often faces are competition and pests.  Her dream is to keep working to be able to get another loan for a greater amount to be able to buy a few hectares of land to grow cacao.

In her free time she likes to listen to music and meet up with neighbors for community programs.  

She is very thankful for the help she has received.

loans.use: to buy seed and farming supplies like urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killer to keep her crops in good condition

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan Carlos; el tiene 27 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad del cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de taxi.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro para comprar repuestos y llantas para su carro. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to Señor de los Temblores-Poroy Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco, province and department of Cusco.

Juan Carlos, 27, is married and has two children.  He alternates his daily activities with his transportation business.  He has a car that he uses as a taxi service in various streets in the city of Cusco.  He works from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m.  With this business Juan Carlos gets his children ahead.  He wants to increase and improve his taxi service.

Juan Carlos is requesting the loan to maintain his car, to buy parts and tires for his car.

He is happy about the loan and is committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: to buy parts and tires to maintain his car.

loans.name: Changeywa S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Changeywa Group in Western Kenya! Boniface is the facilitator of the Changeywa SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Boniface takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Boniface had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Boniface was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Boniface and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Boniface will pay for school fees and other major expenses throughout the year.

In 2012, the members of Changeywa SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La señora Ernestina trabaja en su propia agencia de viajes como administradora y le va muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para invertir en su agencia y desea hacer reserva de boletos turísticos, pasajes aéreos y otras cosas más. A Ernestina el anterior crédito le ayudo en su negocio y sobre todo obtuvo buenas ganancias de las cuales lo utilizo para el gasto familiar.     

La señora Ernestina agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Ernestina runs her own travel agency, and it is going very well. On this occasion, she needs the loan to invest in her agency, and wishes to reserve tourist entrance tickets, airline tickets and other things. 

The previous loan helped Ernestina in her business, and especially, it helped her to make good profits, which she used for her household expenses.  

Ernestina values and is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her monthly instalments.

loans.use: To reserve tourist entrance tickets, airline tickets and other travel items for her business.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: La soica actualmente tiene 45 años de edad; la socia sigue con su negocio propio de venta de comidas en el mercado, la socia ha mejorado su calidad de vida y la de su familia con las inversiones que realiza, ella ahora también cría animeles menores como cuyes, chanchos y aves de corral en muchas ocasiones ella prepara alimentos con la carne que ella misma cría; la socia ha estado sacando los prestamos para invertir en su puesto de venta de comida, e la compra de meza, sillas, utensilios y otros y en esta ocasión desea mejorar y renovar algunos utensilios como cubiertos, vasos y platos para servir las comidas, la socia desea comprar viandas para llevr los alimentos a los negocios de sus clientes, la socia también desea invertir el credito en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los potajes como arroz al por mayor en sacos, aceite en bidones y otros. La socia soliciat el prestamo para invertir en la compra de utensilios para el negocio y de insumos para la elaboración de los potajes.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 45 years old. She is continuing with her business of selling meals in the market. She has improved her quality of life and that of her family with the investments she is making. 

Now she also raises small animals such as guinea pigs, pigs and poultry. On many occasions she prepares food with the meat that she herself raises. She has been taking out loans to invest in her food stall; to buy tables, chairs, utensils and other things,

On this occasion she wishes to improve and replace some utensils, such as cutlery, glasses, and plates for serving the meals. She wishes to buy  containers for taking food to her customers businesses. She also wants to use the loan to buy ingredients for preparing dishes, such as rice sold wholesale in bags, cooking oil in barrels, and other things. She is applying for the loan to buy utensils for the business, and ingredients for making food dishes.

loans.use: To buy utensils for her food stall business, and ingredients for making the dishes.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Doris; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como guía de turismo y también tiene su carro que hace servicio urbano, por medio de este trabajo y de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere terminar de construir su casa y quiere ampliar el negocio de transporte. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como yesos y arena y para el mantenimiento de su carro como llantas.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Doris belongs to the "Señor de los Temblores-Poroy" communal bank. It is located in Cusco district, which is part of Cisco province and department. She is 22, in a common-law relationship, and has a son. 

Along with her daily activities, she works as a tourist guide, and also uses her car as a taxi. By means of this work and her business, she is raising her son. 

She wants to finish building her house, and expand her taxi business. She is applying for the loan to buy construction materials, such as plaster and sand, and to maintain her car; including buying tires.  Doris is happy about the loan, and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as plaster and sand, and for the maintenance of her car, including buying tires.

loans.name: Sango Fellowship Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Mariela Colombia

texts.es:
Mariela Colombia tiene trentaiun años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de diez y siete años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul.

Mariela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza Echeandia. 

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos. Con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ha ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. 

Este nuevo Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque le servirá para comprar semillas, plantas de cacao e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es seguir trabajando para poder adquirir y ser dueño de una finca.En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar los deportes, compartir con la familia, hacer mingas familiares.

"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Mariela Colombia is 31 years old.  She is married and has two children, ages ten and seven.  They live in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province. 

The Nueva Unión Communal Bank is located in the Guamayacu precinct, in Echeandia canton. The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice, kidney beans, and pigeon peas.  Mariela makes her living in agriculture, growing corn, rice, kidney beans, and pigeon peas.  She makes purchases and sells her products in Echeandia.  

With the money from the previous loan, she was able to purchase seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte herbicide, fertilizer, and weed killer to maintain healthy crops.  

Her family relationships have improved because now she can contribute a little more toward the family’s well-being.  Her work is going much better for her because production has increased and she earns more income from the sale of her products.  The support of the previous loan has helped her to succeed and she never had any problem meeting the payment terms established by the cooperative.

This new loan will be a big help because it will enable her to purchase seeds, cacao plants, and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte herbicide, fertilizer, and weed killer to maintain healthy crops. 

The most frequent challenges she faces are competition and blight.   Her dream is to continue working so that she can purchase her own farm.  In her free time, she enjoys playing sports, spending time with her family, and participating in “mingas” (cooperative community projects).  

“She is very grateful for the help being offered.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, cacao plants and agricultural supplies such as urea, fertilizer, Matamonte herbicide, and weed killer to maintain healthy crops.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Gonzalo; el tiene 32 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de juguetes y también el socio trabaja como ayudante de una empresa de transporte, el socio el negocio de venta de juguetes lo realiza en forma ambulatoria, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de juguetes y mejorar en su trabajo de la empresa de transporte.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar juguetes como muñecas y carros al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY” communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco District, which belongs to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

The member is Sr. Gonzalo.  He is 32 years old and single.  He spends his days working in his business selling toys.  He also works as an assistant for a transportation company.  Sr. Gonzalo sells his toys from a street stand, and from that income he is able to help his children get ahead.  He wants to expand his toy selling business and to improve in his work at the transportation company.  He is requesting the loan in order to purchase wholesale toys, such as dolls and toy cars.

Sr. Gonzalo is happy about the loan and promises to comply with his repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale toys, such as dolls and toy cars.

loans.name: Runda A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Runda A Group in Western Kenya! Lydia is the facilitator of the Runda A SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Lydia  takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Lydia had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 6 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Lydia was only able to harvest 1.5 bags of maize on 0.5 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Lydia  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Lydia will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Runda A SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Pamgnodo Group

texts.fr:
Mme Haoua est la représentante du groupe PAMGNODO. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 38ans et le moins âgé a 16ans.01 de ses enfants va à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle prépare et vend le soumbala depuis 20ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants (Tanghin Dassouri et baossa). Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 05 sacs de grains de néré pour la transformation en soumbala et une charrette de bois de chauffe.

Mme épargne et assure la scolarité de ses enfants avec ses économies. Elle ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation et agrandir ses points de vente de soumbala.
texts.en:
Mrs. Haoua represents group Pamgnodo. She is married and a mother of three. Her oldest is 38 years old and her youngest 16. One of her children goes to school. She has five people in her care.

She has been preparing and selling sumbala for twenty years. She gets her supplies from neighboring villages (Tanghin Dassouri and Baossa). Her clients are women and men.

She wants to purchase five bags of African locus beans to prepare sumbala, as well as one cartload of firewood.

She is putting money aside and pays for her children's school with her savings. Her ambition is to build a house to live in and to enlarge her sumbala sales outlets.

loans.use: to buy a cartload of firewood and 5 bags of African locus beans to make sumbala (a traditional condiment).

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de frutas, la socia vende manzanas, naranjas, platanos entre otras frutas, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar naranjas, platanos, uvas, mandarinas y manzanas al por mayor. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY” communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco District, which belongs to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

The member is Sra. Vilma.  She is 29 years old, lives with her partner and has 4 children.  She spends her days working in her fruit business.  She sells apples, oranges and bananas, along with other fruit. She sells her fruit from a street stand and works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  This business allows her to help her children to get ahead.  Sra. Vilma wants to expand her business selling fruit.  She is requesting the loan in order to purchase wholesale oranges, bananas, grapes, tangerines and apples.

Sra. Vilma is happy about the loan and promises to comply with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale oranges, bananas, grapes, tangerines and apples.

loans.name: Nancy Alilian

texts.es:
Nancy Alilian tiene 49 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de veintiuno años de edad en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul.
Nancy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza Echeandia. 

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos. Con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ha ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. 

Este nuevo Crédito le servirá para comprar semillas, plantas de cacao e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es seguir trabajando para poder adquirir y ser dueño de una finca.
En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el boly, compartir con la familia.
"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Nancy Alilian is 49 years old.  She is married and has one son.  She lives with her husband and her son, who is twenty-five years old, in Ventanas Canton, De Los Ríos Province.

The VRC NUEVA UNIÓN is located in Guamayacu Precinct, which belongs to Echeandía Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural work, like growing corn, rice and pigeon peas. 
Nancy makes her living in agriculture, planting corn, rice and pigeon peas.  She makes her purchases and sales in Echeandia. 

With the money from the previous loan, Nancy was able to purchase seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte herbicide, fertilizer and weed poison, to maintain a healthy crop.
The family dynamic has improved because now she can contribute a little more to the family's well-being.  Work has been going much better because she has increased production, and her income has improved a lot because now she earns more from her sales.  The previous loan helped her to better herself, and she had no trouble making her payments to the communal bank on time.

This new loan will help her to purchase seeds, cacao plants and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte herbicide, fertilizer and weed poison so she can maintain a healthy crop.

The challenges that Nancy Alilian frequently faces are: competition and plagues.  Her dream is to continue working and to acquire and become the owner of a farm.

In her free time, Nancy Alilian likes to play sports, in particular volley ball, and to spend time with her family.
"She is very grateful for the assistance she has been offered."

loans.use: to purchase cacao plants and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte herbicide, fertilizer and weed poison, so she can maintain a healthy crop.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es: Rosalba, vive en unos de los barrios populares de la ciudad de León, tiene 38 años de edad, es comerciante, tiene 5 hijos,de los cuales dos de ellos están aún en la secundaria los otros son independientes su esposo trabaja en la alcaldía municipal de Totogalpa municipio de León . Antes ella era ama de casa pero necesitaba apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y además tener una actividad que le permitiera ser independiente y ganar su propio dinero al mismo tiempo cuidar a sus hijos, fue entonces que su esposo la ayudo a poner la pulpería , tiene 4 años de tenerla , sus hijos menores la ayudan a atender el negocio después de clases así ella logra hacer la compra de mercadería para surtir su pulpería, además ella vende ropa, zapato y cosméticos vende de manera ambulante y también en  su pulpería así poco a poco ha venido creciendo su negocio y aportando en su hogar . Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, inventario de granos básicos, enlatados, caramelos, leche, jugos, sodas, jabones para limpiar. EstO le ayudara a tener surtida su pulpería y comprar mercadería en general para vender.  Su próxima meta es lograr poner una tienda de ropa, compra vitrinas y maniquíes para exhibir la ropa.
texts.en: Rosalba lives in one of the neighborhoods around the city of León.  She is 38 years old, a shop owner and has 5 children, two of whom are still in secondary school.  Her other children live independently from her.  Her husband works in the mayor's office of Totogalpa, municipality of León.  Rosalba was a homemaker, but she needed to help her husband with the household expenses.  In addition, she wanted a business that would allow her to be independent and earn her own money but at the same time to take care of her children.  And so her husband helped her to open a small grocery, which Rosalba has now had for 4 years.  Her younger children help her in the store after school, which allows her to go out to purchase merchandise to stock her store.  In addition to running the store, Rosalba sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics from a street stand as well as in her store.  Little by little she has been growing her business and contributing financially to their household.  Rosalba needs the loan to purchase clothing, shoes, cosmetics, basic grain inventory, canned goods, candies, milk, juice, soda and cleaning agents.  The loan will help her to stock up her grocery and to purchase general merchandise to sell.  Her next goal is to open a clothing store and to purchase display cases and mannequins to display the clothing.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, cosmetics, basic grain inventory, canned goods, candies, milk, juice, sodas and cleaning agents.

loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her early 50s, is married and has nine children. Three of them are still at school. She has been a stone quarrier and a buyer of scrappers for seven years now. She works from 6 a.m to 6 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start the business of buying and selling scrappers (scrappers are metal products which are not in use any more, like the left overs of the written-off cars, empty tins and things like old metal dust bins, which are melted into iron bars), paid school fees and household expenses. She has paid back her all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more stones for making more stone quarries and to buy more scrappers to sell. Her dream is to to one day be able to build her own house (a stone quarry is when a big stone is extracted into small stones for building materials).

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Bega Kwa Bega," which has a total of 22 members who will hold each other accountable for paying oback their loans.

loans.use: To buy more stones for making more stone quarries and to buy more scrappers to sell.

loans.name: Bioleta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bioleta; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa y venta de zapatos, la socia vende pantalones, chompas, polos y blusas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatos al por mayor y para comprar polos, chompas, blusas, pantalones y casacas al por mayor. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY” communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco District, which belongs to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

The member is Sra. Bioleta.  She is 32 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She spends her days selling clothing and shoes.  From 8:00am until 6:00pm, she sells pants, sweaters, polo shirts and blouses from a street stand.  Through these businesses, she is able to help her children to get ahead.  Sra. Bioleta wants to expand her business selling clothing and shoes.  She is requesting the loan in order to purchase wholesale shoes and wholesale polo shirts, sweaters, blouses, pants and jackets.

Sra. Bioleta is happy about the loan and promises to comply with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale shoes and wholesale polo shirts, sweaters, blouses, pants and jackets.

loans.name: Delila

texts.es: Delila de 28 años, convive con santos de 48 años, con quien tiene 02 hermosos hijos. Juntos habitan en el distrito de Sivia, donde tienen su propia casa. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de abarrotes, para ello cuenta con una tienda en donde expende sus productos, siendo el má concurrido de su localidad. A pesar de que Delila no tuvo estudios, ella sabe que su mejor arma es su paciencia y la cordialidad que presta a sus clientes, además los precios que ofrece está al alcance de la economía de ellos. Generalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero hay veces que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos, que son quienes lo animan ha continuar con su trabajo. Lo único que la aqueja es la competencia, por ello debe buscar la mejor manera de mantener a la clientela. En un futuro próximo desea implementar mejor su tienda con productos novedosos. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Ella esta contenta con su banco comunal, por que son buenos emprendedores. Con los 1.500 soles que solicita, comprará nuevos productos para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Delila, 28, lives with Santos, 48, with whom she has two beautiful children.  They live together in the district of Sivia, where they have their own house.

Her work is selling groceries, for which she has a store where she sells her products, it being the most popular in the town.  Despite not having an education, Delila knows that her best weapon is her patience and the cordiality she shows her customers.  In addition, the prices she offers are within the reach of their budgets.

Generally she works on her own, but sometimes she has the help of her husband and children, which encourages her to continue with her work.  The only thing that bothers her is competition.  This is why she needs to look for the best way to keep her customers.

In the near future she wants to set up her store better with innovative products.  This will be her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to being punctual with her payments.

She is happy with her communal bank because they are good entrepreneurs.

With the loan of 1,500 PEN that she is requesting, she will buy new products to set up her store.

loans.use: to buy products to set up her store.

loans.name: Donato

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Donato; el tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fabricación y venta de sanitarios, el socio tiene un taller donde fabrica todo tipo de modelos de sanitarios, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de fabricación y venta de sanitarios.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los sanitarios como arena granito, pinturas y pegamentos al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY” communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is in Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Señor Donato; he is 47 years old.  He is in a live-in relationship and has two children.  The member divides his time between his daily activities and his business making and selling toilets.  He has a workshop where he makes all different kinds of toilets, and he works from 7 a.m. till 6 p.m.

The member has been able to move his children ahead in life by means of this business, and wants to expand and improve his business making and selling toilets.

The member is requesting the loan to purchase materials at wholesale for making toilets such as granite sand, paints and glues.

The member is happy about the loan and commits to making his repayments.

loans.use: to purchase materials at wholesale for making toilets, such as granite sand, paints and glues.

loans.name: Rigail Ramiro

texts.es:
Rigail Ramiro tiene 26 años de edad  es casado tiene una hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo de dos años de edad en el cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul.
Rigail se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza Echeandia. 

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos. Con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ha ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. 

Este nuevo Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque le servirá para comprar semillas, plantas de cacao e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es seguir trabajando para poder comprar una casa para la familia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta ver televisión y practicar los deportes en especial el futbol

"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Rigail Ramiro is 26 years old.  He is married with one son, aged two years old, and lives with his wife and son in Ventanas canton, in the province of Los Ríos.

The NUEVA UNIÓN communal bank is located in the Guamayacu precinct, which is part of Echeandía province.  This communal bank focuses on short-cycle agriculture, specifically corn, rice and beans.

Rigail works in agriculture planting corn, rice, and beans.  He makes his purchases and sales in Echeandía . 

With the money from his previous loan, he was able to purchase seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte brand herbicide, fertilizers and weedkiller, in order to keep his crops in good condition.  His family relationships have improved because now he is able to bring in a little more for his family's well-being.  His work is going much better, because he has increased his production and his income has improved greatly too, because now he earns more income from his products.  He has been able to succeed with the help of his previous loan, and he had no problems in making his scheduled repayments to the cooperative.

This new loan will be very helpful, because he will use it to purchase seeds, cocoa plants, and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte brand herbicide, fertilizers, and weedkiller to keep his crops in good condition.

The challenges that he faces most often are the competition and insect infestations.  His dream is to continue working so that he can buy a house for his family.

In his free time he enjoys watching TV and playing sports, especially football.

"He is very grateful for the support being provided".

loans.use: to purchase seeds, cocoa plants, and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte brand herbicide, fertilizers, and weedkiller to keep his crops in good condition.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tocos en diferentes partes de la ciudad. 
Solicita un para invertir en comprar materia para elaborar los guisados y comprar productos desechables como son platos, vaso y servilletas, y así atender mejor a sus clientes, al consumir sus alimentos este cómodos y confiables. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito ya que es viuda y vive con un hijo que esta estudiando. 
Desea mejorar los ingresos de su negocio y de la familia.
texts.en: Victoria makes and sells tacos in various parts of the city.  She’s asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make the food and to buy disposable items like dishes, glasses and napkins to provide better service to her customers while they enjoy her food in comfort and safety. She plans to use part of her profits from the business to repay the loan since she’s a widow and lives with a son who’s going to school.  She wants to improve her business’ and her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tacos.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de huevos sancochados con papas, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de huevos sancochados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar huevos y papas al por mayor. 
                                                                                                                La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Victoria, 50, belongs to the “Señor de los Temblores-Poroy” communal bank located in Cusco District which belongs to Cusco Province and Department.  She is a widow and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with a business selling boiled eggs and potatoes.  She’s a street vendor from 7am until 5pm.  Through this business she’s able to support her children. She wants to expand the business of selling boiled eggs and is asking for a loan to buy eggs and potatoes at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy eggs and potatoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo de 41 años de edad, convive con Inés 54 años, con quien tiene 03 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Sivia. Leonardo es un hombre  que siempre se ha caracterizado por tener una personalidad honorable, él nos comenta, que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar constantemente para obtener todo lo que hasta ahora ha logrado. La encargada en su bodega es su querida esposa, quien administra y dirige todo el movimiento, mientras que Leonardo es el encargado del bar, atendiendo a la clientela. Él está feliz con el negocio que tiene por que gracias a ello puede solventar los gastos de su familia. En un futuro próximo desea abrir una tienda de venta de vestidos ya que en su localidad hace falta uno pero enfocado para los más pequeños. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 soles que solicita, comprará más productos para implementar su bar.
texts.en:
Leonardo, 41, lives with Inés, 54, with whom he has three children.  They live together in their own house located in Sivia District.  Leonardo is a man who has always been noted for having an honorable personality.  He tells us that ever since he was very young he’s had to work constantly to obtain everything he’s accomplished to date.  His beloved wife looks after the store and directs all transactions while Leonardo runs the bar tending to customers.  He is happy with the business he has because thanks to it he’s able to cover family expenses.
